author: {'steamid': '76561198298936268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 4088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4088, 'last_played': 1709370492}
review:
Pontos Positivos:

Crossover de Séries de Animação: Animation Throwdown reúne personagens de séries de animação populares, como Family Guy, Futurama, Bob's Burgers, American Dad e King of the Hill. Isso oferece aos fãs a oportunidade de ver seus personagens favoritos interagindo em um único jogo.

Estratégia de Cartas: O jogo apresenta mecânicas de cartas estratégicas, onde os jogadores montam decks de cartas com personagens e habilidades específicas. A habilidade de construir decks eficazes e usar estratégias táticas durante os combates adiciona profundidade à jogabilidade.

Atualizações Regulares e Eventos Especiais: Animation Throwdown recebe atualizações regulares de conteúdo, incluindo novas cartas, eventos especiais e desafios sazonais. Isso mantém o jogo fresco e emocionante para os jogadores, incentivando-os a retornar regularmente para ver o que há de novo.

Elementos de Coleção: Os jogadores podem colecionar uma variedade de cartas com personagens e habilidades diferentes, incentivando a exploração e a experimentação com diferentes estratégias e combinações de cartas.

Comunidade Ativa: O jogo possui uma comunidade ativa de jogadores que compartilham estratégias, dicas e conteúdo relacionado ao jogo. Isso cria um ambiente social onde os jogadores podem se conectar, competir e colaborar.

Pontos Negativos:

Progressão Lenta: A progressão no jogo pode ser lenta, especialmente para jogadores que optam por não gastar dinheiro real em microtransações. Isso pode levar à sensação de estagnação e frustração para alguns jogadores.

Desbalanceamento de Cartas: Algumas cartas podem ser consideradas desbalanceadas em relação às outras, levando a situações em que certas estratégias ou decks são dominantes e difíceis de superar.

Dependência de Microtransações: Animation Throwdown inclui microtransações para pacotes de cartas e outros itens no jogo. Alguns jogadores podem sentir que isso cria uma vantagem injusta para aqueles que estão dispostos a gastar dinheiro real no jogo.

Repetição de Conteúdo: O jogo pode se tornar repetitivo após um período de tempo, especialmente para jogadores que completam todas as missões e eventos disponíveis. Isso pode levar à falta de variedade e interesse no jogo a longo prazo.

Problemas Técnicos: Alguns jogadores relataram problemas técnicos, como bugs, travamentos e problemas de conectividade. Isso pode interferir na experiência de jogo e causar frustração para os jogadores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017085322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 83335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83335, 'last_played': 1667334190}
review: I had spent couple of hundreds of hours on this game when it was still mobile only. Then, when it released here on Steam, I spent almost 1400 hours on it. Frankly, what kept me playing was the community, and the fact that I had spent more money on this P2W game than I care to admit. Like many other "F2P" games, when you want to achieve something here, be competitive and enjoy the membership of the top 25 guilds, you have to start throwing your money into a botomless pit. Looking back at all those hours has a bittersweet taste for me, and I regret every penny I spent on it.

review:
Další hra ze služby Google Play, na kterou jsem narazil. A pokud jsem ji nehráli, tak ji rozhodně doporučuji. Je to karetní hra o multiversu animáků, které jste určitě mohli vidět v TV (např. Family Guy, American Dad!, Futurama atd.). Hra spočívá v tom, že sbíráte karty do svého decku, a soupeříte s ostatními hráči, hrajete eventy nebo kampaň. Karty jsou o různých postavách, věcech nebo míst z různých seriálů a ty mají životy, útoky a různé schopnosti, a snažíte se zničit oponentova hrdinu.

Hodnocení: 6/10

review: The game is decent enough and I've played it since its inception. Because of this, I've got a good stash of cards, and this makes it mildly enjoyable still. However, I cannot recommend it for new players. You will start with nothing and get dominated by whales from day 1 - not what I'd look for in a new game. Throwdown is not interested in stabilizing the game for all players and just wants to cater to its whales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169302979', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1708819855}
review:
Un gioco di carte simpatico, nient'altro.
Strategia minima, chi ha la prima carta in campo forte vince e non si può ribaltare una partita del genere, visto che è possibile giocare solo una carta a turno.
Il pvp non è in tempo reale, quindi alla fine credo si giochi sempre e solo contro il computer, poi magari a livelli alti le cose cambiano.
L'estetica delle carte e le combinazione sono simpatiche come detto, ma non basta per rendere buono un gioco di carte.
Molto Pay2Win.
Sinceramente non consigliato.

2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199587119128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1707360825}
review:
why is this so fun. i got this game as a joke because bob's burgers is my special interest and it was free. now i can't stop playing and i actually spent my real money for a stupid epic bob belcher card. i'm so mad. i'm so sad. i'm going through the five stages of grief realizing what game i put my money into. peter griffin is in this game dude.....save yourself. but also i love that card with all my heart and soul. this is literally just a mobile game on your computer but i'm glad i don't have it on my phone or else it would be the only thing i'd do.  it is a fun way to turn your brain off to the insanity of it though. like a baby sensory video for me. seems kinda pay-to-win but if you keep on playing i think you'll be okay without spending money i have many more epic cards than the one i bought. resist the payment. i can't tell if i recommend this game or not. 

can i sue this game for exploiting an autistic person?

author: {'steamid': '76561198000507927', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2076, 'last_played': 1708855336}
review: Been gaming since early 1980's, playing card games since MtG release in Aug 1993. Game is ok and funny but do not spend a dime on this game. It is no different than any other micro transaction game. Hands down pay to win game. The game in pvp will pit you against much higher skill players with decks that have more than one card in it that can beat your whole deck hands down. Once in a while it will toss you a lower opponent to keep you thinking your winning. 10-1 run by a algorithm that is geared to keep you around a 45-55% WR if your a decent player. Only way to get any where in this game is to whip out your wallet and spend a small fortune. Games like this should be classified as gambling due to the card packs you buy, most of the time the packs contain crap. Real gamers dont use their wallet, they use skill.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999418665', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 25, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1711412748}
review:
It's just a crap pay to win mobile port.

- You can only play 6 times before you run out of "energy" and have to wait 10 minutes for each "life" to recover, so to get back to full energy it's an hour. And some stages require more than one life to play.
- Crafting combos have ridiculous long timers. Some are 24hs.
- The amount of grind to update your deck is exhausting.
- Every event or mode, like arena, has a limit, so, more timers.
- The game does not have a proper matchmaking, so paying players will destroy you in arena mode.
- Gets repetitive very fast.

Don't get near this crap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040297670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7365, 'last_played': 1689396208}
review:
Note: I switched my play away from Steam and onto my tablet for a better experience. I have more than 122 hours into this game. I really did give it a try and I gave the devs several months to fix the problems listed below.

1.) Don't play this game on Steam. It'll put you at a major disadvantage to other, non-steam players.

2.) People have been spending thousands of dollars per year and/or have been playing this P2W game for years and the devs do too little to attempt to properly match PvP duels (which makes up the bulk of the game) between two people of similar experience and power. While collecting cards and building decks is supposed to be the crux of the game, you will quickly and routinely dominate the non-PvP portion of the game and be dominated in the PvP portion, regardless of your deck composition.

3.) The community is complaining about the dev's poor choices at every level of experience and the devs have been unresponsive. The devs have been focusing on creating new cosmetics for sale rather than fixing bugs and solving non-bug problems.

4.) The P2W/top echelon of players have a more equal duel experience because the bulk of the game at that level revolves around collecting decks that consist solely of one card/combo. These "spam" decks offer very little variety or strategy. Once you've completed a spam deck the devs will create a new, powercreeped card/combo for players to pursue with their money, turning your previous spam decks into antiques.

5.) There are "cheaters", who exploit the inherent disproportion of rewards from one country to another. This game also has a history of people having their accounts hacked.

I think we all understand that people who don't P2W shouldn't expect to win the bulk of their matches, but my experience as a F2L'er is that there is no reason to spend money on the game when the top players are complaining about the lack of fun, the devs don't listen, and the poor matchmaking makes no amount of strategy or deck composition matter. There was no challenge or fun for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142067215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1710304157}
review: A tale about a guy that 7 years ago found a cool mobile game that actually was a "challenge" compared to most, but since the theme is Animation Domination he gets it [free-as it is on here]. Guy gets various new phones and 7 years later finds this on Steam, complete with the ad freebies. Having been away for some time, the guy had a number of gifts that allowed him to go from beginner deck to half legendary  having spent 0 dollars [game messages from 2018 were there so figure how much loot was there from the messages received now]. I recommend it for fans of Animation Domination, who know their stuff and for those who also enjoy what has got to be the stupidest reason for a real time strategy [you will be using the free ffwd in game as you can have "battle walls" of cards 4-5 deep.] card game. It is addicting. The tutorial is perfect as you can lose [ unlikely, but possible]. The draw is the character combos [over 2000 cards] and the "add-ons" in battle ranging from evil monkey [Family Guy]  to gas to even golden turds. which give various boosts to you or takes from your opponent and gets more complicated the higher the cards. You have in game real money options that if you wish to go that route can be very lucrative in the guild when you join real world people in card battles. You do not have  to spend money if you manage in game resources. You can not to my knowledge combine mobile with PC accounts [ IF YOU KNOW HOW feel free to discuss. I have premium mobile which is ad free and would not mind getting OP]. 4/4 Qdub says check it out.

review: Throwdown bietet humorvolle Kartenspiel-Action mit beliebten Fox-Animationsshows. Trotz anfänglicher Leichtigkeit, sei gewarnt vor nervigen Timern und einem möglichen P2W-Faktor in fortgeschrittenen Stufen. Spass mit Combo Karten ist zwar garantiert, aber Vorsicht vor fiesen Energielimits und hinterhältigen Bezahlfallen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198336656958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 389546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 606, 'playtime_at_review': 385722, 'last_played': 1712432538}
review:
Das Spiel lässt sich öfters nicht Laden so das man aus der Gilde geworfen wird obwohl man keine Schuld hat und man versucht wenn das Spiel wieder funktioniert das richtigzustellen die Gilden ein einfach Bannen ohne überhaupt zu wissen was überhaupt passiert ist,
Ich Spiele schon seit mehreren Jahren und hatte jedes Jahr 3-4 mal diesen Fehler das wenn die Wolken verschwinden ich nicht rein kam oder das Spiel nur 22% geladen wurde und nicht weiter ging.
Nach einer Spielzeit von insgesamt  6428 Stunden bin ich jetzt momentan in keiner Gilde da ich sowieso wieder rausgeschmissen werde.
Meine ganzen Täglichen Belohnungen und hart erspielten unterbrochenen Event Belohnungen konnte ich in den Zeiten wo das Spiel nicht funktionierte nicht bekommen oder verbessern.
Zum Glück habe ich nichts für Echt Geld gekauft da ich mich dann nur noch mehr ärgern würde.
Daher kann ich Animation Throwdown nicht empfehlen.
Wenn mich Trotzdem eine Gilde haben möchte und mein Problem versteht meine Spieler ist ID - 9076615 
und es muss nicht unbedingt eine Deutsche Gilde sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561199491678741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 4098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4072, 'last_played': 1702396322}
review: Had a card that had different effects than a card of the same rarity, leveled and name as another card. The only difference were the effects on said cards I also noticed the card didn't have the effects in the level up screen as when on the field. It wasn't until the "card masters" torment finished and I got a lot more of the card did I noticed the card got nerfed so that the stats matched. Feels like and switch after moneys been put in the game not that I'd ever waste money on this. Aside from that the energy system is what kills it more than anything. You get one energy per ten minutes and you start with a max of six while getting one to your max per player level. Most people don't go past 15 and after playing for a week or so activity I'm level 7 so my max energy is 11. For context missions take more energy based on where they're at progress wise and the ones I'm trying to do take five. That means without failing I'm allowed to progress two missions at hour. That I get a six or seven minute playtime to a hour of waiting. Thats insanely greedy and a reason to never sink money into something like this.

review:
Very fun and addicting card game with many unique elements!
Has cards on some of the most iconic TV shows such as Family Guy, Archer, Futurama, King of the Hill, and Bob's Burgers!
You can even play as the legendary Brian Griffin himself!
Its also not as focused on micro-transactions compared to every other collectible deck builder card games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115909996', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 29153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 907, 'playtime_at_review': 21041, 'last_played': 1712249510}
review:
Animation Throwdown - это забавная и увлекательная карточная игра, в которой вы можете собирать и комбинировать персонажей из пяти популярных мультсериалов: Family Guy, Futurama, Bob’s Burgers, American Dad и King of the Hill. Вы можете сражаться с другими игроками в режиме Battlemode или проходить сюжетную кампанию, в которой вам предстоит спасти мир от промышленной катастрофы. В игре есть множество смешных и оригинальных комбо-карт, которые отражают характер и юмор каждого шоу. Например, вы можете объединить Гермеса из Futurama с карточкой Спорт и получить Чемпиона по лимбо, или сделать из Мег из Family Guy Красавицу-зверя.

Animation Throwdown - это игра, которая порадует не только фанатов этих мультсериалов, но и любителей карточных игр. Игра имеет простое и удобное управление, красочную и детализированную графику, забавный и захватывающий саундтрек. Игра также постоянно обновляется и добавляет новый контент, такой как карточки, события, испытания и т.д. Вы можете играть в Animation Throwdown бесплатно, но если вы хотите получить больше возможностей и ускорить свой прогресс, вы можете приобрести специальные предметы за реальные деньги.

Animation Throwdown - это игра, которая заслуживает вашего внимания, если вы ищете что-то веселое и интересное, чтобы скоротать время. Это игра, которая заставит вас смеяться и радоваться, когда вы будете создавать свою колоду из любимых персонажей и смотреть, как они дерутся друг с другом. Это игра, которая подарит вам много положительных эмоций и впечатлений. Это игра, которую вы должны попробовать, если вы еще этого не сделали.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329694243', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1913, 'last_played': 1700905637}
review:
For a game that was originally a mobile app, I'm stunned at the complexity, depth, and countless layers in the game play! I've had to 'get into' Pokémon due to my kids, and even earlier than that, I had friends playing Magic the Gathering, and though I never learned or played it, I picked up a little about it just from watching. I can genuinely say that, for me, personally, Animation Throwdown seems far more complicated than [i]any[/i] card game I've played. 

It may just be me, so remember these are the opinions of other players  :)  but my advice would be to not allow the "cartoon-ish" look and feel fool you. Sure, the game is quite easy in the beginning, but you [i]will[/i] find challenges down the line if you keep playing. Of that I can promise you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198100151309', 'num_games_owned': 10, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1697215647}
review: It's fun but I feel like there's a heavy emphasis on pay to win in order to unlock more research slots, better chances of rare cards etc. I used to play this game on my phone like 2 years ago and it felt a lot more balanced back then. I'm fairly certain there used to be 3 research slots available and now it's been reduced to 2 with one locked behind a paywall. A little disappointing. Other than that the characters can be entertaining but I do wish they would give players that don't want to or can't afford to buy a bunch of packs and gems more fair opportunities to advance in the game.

review:
I was pleasantly surprised by the gameplay.  The predatory monetization is ultracancer, but if you manage to ignore that (a tall order) the card play is quite fun.

Edit: After a while of playing, the monetization has just become too much.  You cannot even play more than a handful of rounds before being time gated, and you need to either wait or pay up to play more. On top of that, the imbalance between premium and non premium cards is extreme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243589750', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 915, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1694043085}
review:
Tudo sobre: Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards | "É um verdadeiro presente para os fãs das séries animadas da Fox" (Valxb21) Recomendo.

Claro, aqui vai uma observação engraçada sobre o jogo:

"Às vezes, parece que as batalhas de cartas são mais intensas do que os debates de uma reunião de família na casa dos Griffins! Afinal, quem precisa de terapia quando você pode resolver seus problemas jogando cartas de personagens hilários de diferentes desenhos animados?" 😄

História (8/10):

A história de "Animation Throwdown" é um verdadeiro presente para os fãs das séries animadas da Fox. Reúna personagens icônicos de "Family Guy", "Futurama", "American Dad", "King of the Hill" e "Bob's Burgers" em uma batalha épica pelo controle do multiverso. O enredo é cheio de referências engraçadas e situações absurdas que fazem você rir alto. No entanto, não espere uma trama profunda, pois o foco aqui é o humor.

 Parte Educacional de "Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards":

"Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards" é um jogo que, embora seja principalmente focado na diversão e no entretenimento, possui alguns elementos educacionais que podem ser explorados:

1. Conhecimento de Personagens:

Positivo: O jogo apresenta personagens de várias séries de animação adulta, o que pode estimular os jogadores a conhecerem mais sobre esses programas de TV.
Negativo: A profundidade do conhecimento sobre esses personagens é limitada, pois o jogo não fornece informações detalhadas sobre eles.

2. Estratégia e Tomada de Decisões:

Positivo: A jogabilidade requer estratégia e tomada de decisões, pois os jogadores devem escolher quais cartas usar em momentos específicos durante as batalhas.
Negativo: Embora estimule a tomada de decisões, a estratégia do jogo não está diretamente relacionada a conteúdo educacional.

3. Coleta de Cartas:

Positivo: A mecânica de coletar cartas pode ensinar aos jogadores sobre a organização e categorização, pois as cartas são agrupadas em diferentes temas das séries animadas.
Negativo: Não há informações educacionais associadas às cartas ou aos temas das séries.

4. Desenvolvimento de Habilidades Analíticas:

Positivo: O jogo pode ajudar a desenvolver habilidades analíticas, já que os jogadores precisam avaliar as estatísticas das cartas e planejar estratégias com base nessas informações.
Negativo: A análise necessária no jogo não está relacionada a conteúdo educacional específico.

5. Socialização e Cooperação:

Positivo: O modo multiplayer incentiva a socialização e a cooperação entre os jogadores, o que pode ser benéfico em termos de interação social.
Negativo: Não há elementos educacionais diretos ligados a essa interação.

6. Alfabetização Básica:

Positivo: Embora não seja o foco principal do jogo, a leitura de nomes de personagens e descrições de cartas pode ajudar na prática da alfabetização básica.
Negativo: Não há exercícios ou atividades específicas de alfabetização.

Jogabilidade (9/10):

A jogabilidade é viciante e estratégica. Você constrói um baralho com personagens e cartas de habilidade de diferentes séries e, em seguida, enfrenta outros jogadores em batalhas baseadas em turno. A estratégia é fundamental, já que você precisa equilibrar as habilidades de seus personagens e cartas para derrotar seus oponentes. O modo multiplayer é a cereja do bolo, permitindo que você desafie jogadores de todo o mundo e teste suas habilidades estratégicas.

Modo Multiplayer:

Positivo: O modo multiplayer é o ponto alto do jogo, permitindo confrontos emocionantes com jogadores de todo o mundo, o que adiciona uma camada competitiva muito bem-vinda.
Negativo: No entanto, é necessário um bom equilíbrio entre as cartas dos jogadores para garantir partidas justas.

Conquistas (7/10):

As conquistas em "Animation Throwdown" fornecem uma motivação extra para jogar, pois você é recompensado por alcançar diversos marcos no jogo. No entanto, algumas conquistas podem ser um pouco grindy e demoradas, o que pode ser frustrante para alguns jogadores.

Bugs (6/10):

Infelizmente, o jogo tem sofrido com problemas de bugs ao longo do tempo. Alguns jogadores relatam travamentos e problemas de conectividade que podem atrapalhar a experiência. No entanto, a equipe de desenvolvimento está ativa na resolução desses problemas, o que é um ponto positivo.

Parte Gráfica (8/10):

Os gráficos são agradáveis e fiéis ao estilo das séries animadas da Fox. Os personagens são bem desenhados e as animações durante as batalhas são suaves e engraçadas. No entanto, não espere gráficos de última geração, pois o estilo é mais cartunesco.

Trilha Sonora (7/10):

A trilha sonora é composta por músicas divertidas que se encaixam bem com o humor do jogo. No entanto, ela pode se tornar um pouco repetitiva após um tempo de jogo. Seria bom ter uma variedade maior de músicas para manter o interesse.

Nota Geral (8/10):

"Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards" é um jogo incrivelmente divertido para os fãs das séries animadas da Fox. A jogabilidade estratégica, a história engraçada e o modo multiplayer são os pontos fortes. No entanto, os problemas de bugs e a trilha sonora repetitiva podem afetar a experiência. Se você está disposto a superar esses obstáculos, prepare-se para horas de diversão hilariante no multiverso das animações.

Crítica:

Um ponto de crítica seria a monetização do jogo, que pode ser um pouco agressiva em relação às microtransações. Embora seja possível progredir sem gastar dinheiro real, alguns jogadores podem se sentir pressionados a fazê-lo para avançar mais rapidamente. Seria bom ver um equilíbrio melhor nesse aspecto.

Conclusão:

Em conclusão, Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards é um jogo que certamente vai cativar os fãs de animações adultas, proporcionando uma experiência divertida e estratégica. Com personagens icônicos e um modo multiplayer emocionante, ele oferece muitas horas de entretenimento.

Embora tenha seus pontos fortes, como uma jogabilidade viciante e conquistas estimulantes, o jogo também apresenta algumas áreas que podem ser aprimoradas, como uma trama mais envolvente e uma atualização gráfica. No entanto, esses aspectos não impedem que Animation Throwdown seja uma ótima opção para quem busca diversão e desafio.

Com uma nota final de 8.5/10, é fácil recomendar este jogo para os fãs das séries de animação apresentadas e para aqueles que gostam de jogos de cartas estratégicos. É uma jornada incrível em busca das melhores cartas, repleta de humor e desafios, que certamente vai agradar a muitos jogadores.

review:
This game is really fun when you're bored and looking for something easy to play. It can be as slow or as fast paced as you'd like.  I don't like the imbalance though when pvp'ing because of all the in-game micro transactions. I hate how annoying it is when I run out of arena energy or am researching and must wait a lock out period to continue. 

The cards are HILARIOUS and so is some of their chatter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075616912', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1691264128}
review:
Woran erkennt man ein totes Pay 2 Win Spiel? 
Wenn sich keine Werbepartner mehr finden, die Werbe-Videos im Spiel schalten wollen und der süchtige Zahlsklave seine kostenlosen 10 Rubine durch das Anschauen von diesen Videos nicht mehr verdoppeln kann.

Zum Spiel selber kann ich nur sagen, übelster Pay 2 Win Schmutz. Man bekommt hier das volle Abzock-Programm, angefangen von verschiedenen Währungen, die die horrenden Kosten verschleiern sollen, über Rubine mit dem sich alles bezahlen lässt und sehr langen Forschungszeiten, Lootboxen bis hin zu zeitlich limitierter Spielzeit, die sich nur gegen Echtgeld verlängern lässt. 
Zu allem Übel spielt sich das Spiel faktisch selbst, Nach Aktivierung von Autodeck und Autokämpfen besteht meine Interaktion mit dem Spiel eigentlich nur noch aus täglichem Button-Anklicken. Das läuft in etwa so ab. Ich klicke auf PVP oder auf einen PVE Inhalt, starte den Kampf, öffne den Broswer, surfe auf y0up0rn, komme 2 Minuten später zurück, klicke auf "nochmal", öffne den Broswer undso weiter.. bis meine kostenlose "Spielzeit" aufgebraucht ist, schließe das Spiel und mache das gleiche am nächsten Tag nochmal und am übernächsten Tag ebenso. 

Und warum mach ich das? Ich vermute, weil ich ein wenig blöd bin.
(Und wegen der Steamachievements, die man nebenbei erfarmen kann).

author: {'steamid': '76561199059048747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1971, 'last_played': 1670563987}
review:
Step into the animated universe where characters from your favorite shows join forces in an epic card-battling extravaganza! Animation Throwdown is the game that'll have you ROFLing (Rolling On the Floor Laughing) as you collect cards, build decks, and unleash the wackiest combos in the history of card games! 🤪🎭🃏

From the hilariously dysfunctional Griffin family in Family Guy to the outrageous misadventures of Bob Belcher in Bob's Burgers, the game brings together the best of animated comedy. Picture this: Stewie Griffin teaming up with Tina Belcher in a card duel of epic proportions! 🍔🍿🤖

The gameplay is as addictive as a giant vat of cheesy poofs (you know you can't resist)! You'll collect cards featuring your favorite characters, each with their own unique abilities and one-liners that'll have you giggling like a baby in a bounce house. 😆🎈👶

But the real fun begins when you start crafting your decks, combining characters from different shows to create unstoppable combos. Want to see Peter Griffin team up with Hank Hill to sell propane and propane accessories while unleashing a Megalomaniacal Stewie? You got it! 🍔🔥🍼

The events and challenges in Animation Throwdown will keep you as entertained as a clown at a birthday party. Whether it's Clash of Clones or the Turf Wars, you'll find yourself strategizing, laughing, and sometimes scratching your head in delight as you navigate the animated madness! 🎉🎊🎪

But beware, because just like Lois Griffin dealing with her quirky family, you'll encounter opponents with decks that are as cunning as Wile E. Coyote's plans to catch the Road Runner. Winning battles requires more than luck; it takes strategy, wit, and a pinch of good ol' cartoon physics! 💥🐇🏃‍♂️

The graphics are as colorful and vibrant as a kaleidoscope on steroids, with animations that'll make you feel like you're watching an episode of your favorite show. The attention to detail is so on point that you'll swear you can hear the characters' voices as they battle it out! 🌈📺🎨

But wait, there's more! The community is as lively as a Looney Tunes marathon. Join forces with fellow players, share deck-building tips, and discuss the latest episodes of your beloved shows. It's like joining a virtual animated fandom party that never ends! 🥳🎉👨‍👩‍👧‍👦

In conclusion, Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards is a side-splittingly hilarious card game that'll bring together your favorite animated worlds in a frenzy of laughter and strategy. It's the perfect blend of animation, comedy, and card battles, wrapped up in a rainbow-colored explosion of fun! 🌈🤣🎭

So dive into the animated madness, collect your favorite characters, and battle your way to victory. Whether you're a card game enthusiast or just a fan of animated hilarity, Animation Throwdown is the quest you've been waiting for! 🃏🎮🤩

Final Verdict: Animation Throwdown is a card-clashing masterpiece that'll have you laughing out loud and strategizing like a genius. It's a wild ride through the animated world that'll keep you entertained for hours on end! 🤪🌟🃏

author: {'steamid': '76561199001855764', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1838, 'last_played': 1686613885}
review: Nekem nagyon bejött. Rengeteg az utalás benne a sorozatokból, vicces visszalátni olyan dolgokat, amiket már látott az ember. A mechanikája elég jó, habár igazából majdnem minden az első két körben dől el. Kipróbálásra, pár alkalomra ajánlom, érdemes belekukkantani a poénos kártyák és az elég jó rendszere miatt. De ha valaki komolyabban akar játszani vele, annak igen sok furcsasággal kell szembenéznie. Először is amit kiemelnék, az a kongregate weboldal használatának szükségessége. Rengeteg előnyt ad, ha egy egy research előtt felmész a weblapra és boostolod az időt. Enélkül konkrétan egy örökkévalóság egy-egy kombót kifejleszteni. Másrészt a guild chat sem elérhető ingame, csak a weboldalról. A másik személyes problémám, az az energy rendszer. Tiszta, vágom, hogy telefonjáték volt eredetileg. De ez a rengeteg várakoztatás egyszerűen szar. Nagyon nehezen lehet emiatt haladni. De a negatívumoktól eltekintve, szerethető játék. Lehet rá haragudni, sokszor, könnyen, de szerethető. Érdemes kipróbálni.

author: {'steamid': '76561198885231017', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1685981140}
review:
Great game other than putting you up against opponents you have no chance of defeating which  makes both the guild battles and arena unplayable at times. 

I don't have any gold cards and opponents were playing two or more at a time.  All I could do was delay the loss as their cards would take mine out in one hit most every time.

There are also no videos to double the rewards despite asking if you want to double the rewards.  

Fun game but looses it's enjoyment quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198957118865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1649208421}
review:
As an avid fan of both card games and animated television series, I was thrilled to discover Animation Throwdown on Steam. Let me start by saying that this game is an absolute delight for anyone who appreciates the humor, characters, and universes of popular animated shows. It successfully combines the best elements of collectible card games with a fantastic roster of beloved cartoon series, creating a unique and addictive gaming experience.

One of the standout features of Animation Throwdown is the impressive variety of animated franchises it brings together. From iconic shows like Family Guy, Futurama, American Dad, Bob's Burgers, and King of the Hill, to lesser-known gems like Archer and Bobs Burgers, the game offers a diverse selection that caters to a wide range of animation enthusiasts. The ability to build decks with characters, items, and skills from these beloved shows is an absolute treat for fans.

The gameplay mechanics are intuitive and easy to grasp, making it accessible to both newcomers and experienced players alike. The strategic element of building and optimizing your deck, along with the tactical choices you make during battles, keeps the gameplay engaging and challenging. The card interactions and combos are cleverly designed, offering a satisfying depth of strategy that keeps you constantly engaged.

The graphics and artwork in Animation Throwdown are charming and faithful to the original animation styles of the respective shows. The character cards are visually appealing, and the animations during battles are smooth and enjoyable to watch. Additionally, the humorous dialogue and references to the shows add an extra layer of enjoyment, immersing players further into the animated worlds they love.

The game provides a decent progression system with regular events, challenges, and rewards, ensuring that there is always something to work towards. It's exciting to unlock new cards, strengthen your deck, and rise through the ranks. However, it's worth noting that the free-to-play aspect does introduce some elements of grind and occasional reliance on in-game purchases to speed up progress. While it's not overly intrusive, it's something to be mindful of if you prefer a more casual gaming experience.

Furthermore, the community aspect of Animation Throwdown is commendable. Participating in guilds and interacting with fellow players adds a social dimension to the game. Collaboration during events and sharing strategies fosters a sense of camaraderie among players, enhancing the overall experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198962740920', 'num_games_owned': 1096, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 27132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25494, 'last_played': 1690371527}
review: La verdad que es un juego bastante entretenido para esos momentos muertos en los que no sabes que jugar , Mezcla varias franquicias de fox populares y otras no tanto en la que podes hacer mazos bastante variados ,los simpsons no estan porque obviamente se perderia el factor de variedad :v , pero esta bastante bien tiene cartas bastante graciosas y otras muy wtf. El sistema de progresion es extramademente lento ya el juego tiene todas las pautas de un pay to win desde energias por tiempo , hasta paquetes de cartas , y boost de recursos. Pero a pesar de todo eso yo pude llegar a la liga mas alta de las rankeds del juego sin meter dinero y sin tener ni siquiera una carta legendaria ,lo cual hace que el juego no sea injugable si no te interesa meter dinero en el , lo doy mi visto bueno ya que la pase bastante bien a pesar de sus muchos defectos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149729206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 20635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1048, 'playtime_at_review': 2128, 'last_played': 1712413226}
review:
I had problems when I originally installed this program on my mac.  Played it for a few days.   During an update, it just stopped working.  All of the Local Files were gone.  I stopped playing.   And then I came back to this game. There was another update.  And it started working again.  I do enjoy it.  Hopefully it works ok now.

07/26/2023: UPDATE killed the game again.  It worked fine on my mac for quite a while.  And then after another update... the same problem happened again.  Hopefully they do another update to fix this.

08/06/2023: Game still isn't working on my Mac. I can't recommend a game which doesn't work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999323362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3460, 'last_played': 1685305622}
review:
Jest źle, ale ogólnie na mały plus...

Jeżeli drażni Cię ogromna powtarzalność - odpuść sobie ten tytuł. W pewnym momencie (i to bardzo szybko) ta gra staje się tak monotonna, że aż boli. Są momenty, że człowiek po prostu wchodzi do gry (patrz. uzależnienie), klika bezmyślnie kolejne walki/questy bazujące na walkach (można je przyśpieszać, a od któregoś tam poziomu nawet automatycznie pomijać) i zbierać... no własnie, EXPa? Niekoniecznie, a raczej nie zawsze, bo ostatnio (mimo uczestniczenia we wszystkim, w czym tylko się da) mój poziom nie wzrasta, a dostaję tylko różnego rodzaju pierdoły do przyśpieszenia gry, ulepszenia kart lub też same karty.

Chociaż w growym sklepie jest do kupienia (za realne dolce) szeroki wachlarz przedmiotów (głównie legendarnych kart, których wytwarzanie woła o pomstę do nieba) i innych ,,przyśpieszaczy", to jednak nie widziałem tu przejawów P2W, wręcz przeciwnie - stopniowy progres pozwala graczowi czerpać z rozgrywki pewnego rodzaju satysfakcję - głównie dla zbieraczy (sam mam w ekwipunku kilkaset kart). Zresztą, aktualnie dość łatwo można zdobyć w grze sporo standardowej waluty, a nawet specjalne diamenty, które pozwalają - w granicach rozsądku - zrobić ,,coś więcej" (patrz. przyśpieszacze lub kupno kolejnych, najczęściej losowych kart).

Osobiście nie widzę już w niej (od jakiegoś/dłuższego czasu) realnych wyzwań i czuję, że niebawem (to już chyba będzie trzeci raz na przestrzeni ostatnich kilku lat) ją porzucę, bo... mimo wszystko... nie ma w niej co robić. Ile razy można robić te same zadania i zdobywać kolejne, często podobne do siebie karty?

Jeżeli natomiast bawią Cię odniesienia do kultowych animacji, czyli zbieranie ,,unikalnych'' kart i robienie z nich (niekiedy całkiem zabawnych) combosów - ta gra jest dla Ciebie, chociażby na kilka godzin. W sumie to jedyny plus, ale i tak uważam, że warto dać jej szansę i nabić kilka poziomów.

PS. Kilka lat temu grałem w nią na telefonie, potem ją porzuciłem. Następnie znowu grałem na telefonie i po chwili przerzuciłem się na Steama, gdzie po jakimś czasie znów ją porzuciłem. Aktualnie gram tylko na Stramie - gdzie pewnie trzeci raz ją wywalę po kilkudziesięciu godzinach rozgrywki.

Ale... i tak pewnie do niej następnie wrócę, za rok, może dwa. Zobaczymy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198961484104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1683080758}
review:
Pay to win $$$, or just don't even play. Unfortunately the only fun part of the game is opening a pack and its over within a half of a second. The excitement of getting a 'good' card fades the moment the animation fades and even using the card in the game brings out more depression as to how few of these great cards you have... causing you to go back to the store and reset the process.

This game is VERY boring if you don't buy premium card packs and a lot of them because then the gambling endorphins activate in burst every time you buy. Buying just a few doesn't make a difference and the game remains very boring so you have to "buy, buy, buy!" to keep it fun.

In my honest opinion games with this kind of business model (abusing gambling logic) should be illegal and everyone who profits from them should be prosecuted for harm they have caused.

author: {'steamid': '76561199106158230', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1682276669}
review:
Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards - это уникальная карточная игра, которая объединяет персонажей и миры из популярных мультсериалов, таких как Family Guy, American Dad, Bob's Burgers и многих других. Эта игра предлагает увлекательный геймплей, отличную графику и забавных персонажей, которые привлекут внимание как поклонников мультсериалов, так и новичков.

В игре есть множество карточных колод, которые можно настраивать и улучшать, чтобы создать сильнейшую комбинацию для победы над противником. Кроме того, игра предлагает различные режимы, включая сюжетные миссии, арены и PvP-бои, что добавляет разнообразия и долговечности к игровому опыту.

Одним из преимуществ этой игры является то, что она не требует больших затрат времени и денег, чтобы получить удовольствие от игры. Несмотря на то, что игра имеет механику микротранзакций, она не является пей-ту-вин, и вы можете легко получать карты и улучшения, играя бесплатно.

В целом, Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards - это отличная карточная игра, которая может заинтересовать как поклонников мультсериалов, так и тех, кто ищет увлекательный и красочный геймплей.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996707987', 'num_games_owned': 11706, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 22593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 398, 'playtime_at_review': 5912, 'last_played': 1712403090}
review:
I am a fan of Family Guy and American Dad, the other series not so much, so it's nice to see the characters in a game.
Although i am not a fan (anymore) of online games like this, usually pay to win. 

As usual in the beginning you get (over)loaded with freebies and goodies to get you a decent set, which also involves some luck and doing some quests, but a majority of these quests will run out and then you only get rewards for logging daily or do very specific quests which are minor.

Now with it all said you can get a decent set that will beat most players (that got very bad ones) and go through the adventure chapters, but there will be pay to win players that got much better cards then you, even mythic (golden) ones that you are simply not gonna beat, unless you throw in some money (and it doesn't come cheap, $50-$100 packs).

When you battle other players they don't need to be online, you just play them automatically, you can speed up battles and even select auto battle (although it doesn't always choose the best cards).

But my biggest gripe is how the last few chapters of the adventure part and the archer part, even with decent cards are practically impossible to beat, which only affects ingame quests.
The steam achievements you can fairly get without paying for anything.
Oh and another  gripe is you can't play this in a windowed mode and the game really stays on top, so it's slightly annoying.

Aside from getting better cards, trying to complete the adventure, you can join a guild (with no interaction and most will kick you after a few days of inactivity) and do battles and sieges, but you already get so much personal battles a day (about 40-50) it just gets tedious, and eventually i can understand you might just get bored with it.

So it has it's ups and downs, which makes it a mixed review, but since you can't and i do favor the shows, i will give it a positive review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353404109', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1680822609}

author: {'steamid': '76561198856591929', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1679732416}
review:
Год назад, когда Animation Throwdown только вышел на мобильных устройствах, играл в неё достаточно долго. Да, тут нет той глубины, как в Heartstone, но это в первую очередь фановая и затягивающая карточная игра, которая позволяет провести часик в день, не напрягая особо мозги.

Плюсы:
+ Большое разнообразие карт из 5-ти вселенных. Разработчики постоянно добавляют все новые и новые карты - и это здорово.
+ Много разнообразных играбельных персонажей со своими фишками.
+ Множество комбинаций карт, что предоставляет достаточно большую вариативность геймплею.
+ Юмор
+ Легкость в освоении
+ Донат, который не сильно влияет на геймплей. Побеждать можно не заплатив ни цента, нужно только потратить определенное количество времени на исследования и фарм заданий.
+ Множество игровых режимов
+ Возможность играть одновременно на мобильном устройстве и на пк с синхронизацией игрового процесса

Минусы:
- В пк версии убрали возможность увеличения бонуса за просмотр рекламы, добавив платный бустер
- Очень долгие исследования и восполнение энергии
- Отсутствие реального ПВП - лишь его имитация

По итогу имеем веселую карточную игру, которая не напрягает мозги, а дарит море фана и веселья. Попробовать стоит, даже если не любите жанр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228711100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1676825285}
review:
Animation Throwdown -это тактическая карточная игра, будет интересна тем, кто знаком с мульт.сериалами на 2х2, или имеет опыт игры в карточные игры по типу Hearthstone. На картах использовано изображение большинства основных мульт.персонажей, но почему-то нет самых узнаваемых -Симпсонов!? 
Первый десяток партий игра заботливо знакомит с правилами, предоставляя подсказки. Ну а спустя пару часов, резко врываются донатеры со сказочными сборками блестящих карт и большим количеством хп чем у тебя...ну и вообщем то и всё...

review: This game is really enjoyable but I am worried that the battles could start getting too difficult if I keep playing too long. Having Animation Domination cartoon characters in the game makes it a little bit more fun. I just played for a couple hours to see what the game is like and now I reset the game so I can start over from the beginning. I started a new game and got three powerful Legendary cards close to the beginning of the game without spending any money and that is making the game a lot more enjoyable. I just tried playing in the arena today for the first time, and I won so much that they have me fighting against people a lot higher levels than me with better cards and combos who are actually spending money on the game. I don't like constantly fighting against people a lot stronger than me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978525901', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1673035365}
review: I guess it's a game, I mean i got all of the achievements but did I actually achieve anything? You collect cards based on a bunch of cartoons, you can fuse them to make stronger combos and fight in very lacklustre battles. You can pay to get better cards early but I played free. It's a real slog until you hit level 10, now you can auto battle. This really opens up the game, everything goes faster and I seemed to get better cards as soon as it unlocked. By the time I hit lvl 15 for multiplayer I had so many purple rarity cards that I was winning most battles. Ultimately I would not recommend it and I promptly uninstalled after the last achievement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149212936', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 17187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15421, 'last_played': 1674517362}
review: Person I had fun with, at the time of writing this, am still having fun with this, and never paid a single penny. I played this quite a bit during work, so it's been easier for me to rack up the hours I have. Why I play this during work? It's fun and engaging to pay attention to, but you can also set it to battle mode while you're taking a call or doing some exercise. It makes grinding less of a hassle for me personally. I've managed to build a decent deck at my level I think. All in all, it's a fun F2P experienece. Works fine on the steam deck with the touchscreen, and you bring your account to other platforms. (you have to create an account with kongregate though) If you have bad impulsive spending habits and need to stay away from F2P games that are chocked full of microtransactions and pay to win things, then stay away and keep anyone you know who has those habits far away. As is the case with most F2P games, they have free solutions to leveling the playing field, but unless you don't mind waiting or have some solution, this game will have top players and decks that are near impossible to get pass without extensive leveling up/experience. Game is basically full of F2P BS, but the gameplay is fun and it has the funny cartoon franchises I know and love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057725854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1981, 'last_played': 1693495390}
review:
Things I like:
* has a bunch of different characters/items from the different shows
* being able to automate some the grinding games

Things I don't like:
* constantly needing to buy something or get more tokens otherwise you will never win against other players
* the need to log in all the time to do stuff
* even guilds want you to login every day and compete in every guild battle - you can just not be in a guild but the game makes the achievements so you have to

This is a machine that pushes all the buttons to get you to spend money. DO NOT play this game if you have gambling issues, neuro-divergent where you can be manipulated because you feel you're not keeping up AND especially if you don't have any money to lose (regardless of your brain) because this "game" will hit you with all those things (every day login bonus, Mythic tier cards that basically cost a lot of money, all the timed competitions and timed junk) till you feel sick.

I've put in a little money but I can see many other people that I've played against that must have put in $100's. It takes a lot of money to get a Mythic card or about 8 months of grinding.
I will keep playing as I look at how it's built and start to build my own (non-money grubbing) version of this card game.

tl;dr "line go up" junk that's built to take money. DO NOT PLAY

author: {'steamid': '76561198424411734', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 18588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15588, 'last_played': 1678427525}
review:
I keep getting pulled back into this game, so there is something about it that I love. I'm not entirely sure what it is, either. Maybe it's because it doesn't track your wins/losses (I HATE games that do that), or maybe it's because I can use Futurama cards and it reminds me of when I was younger when my mom would let me stay up until 11 just to watch it.

Or maybe it's just because it's a good game. It's well-made and has constant events going on. You will get sucked into this one.

It is also important to note though, that this is a game that is catered towards those who give them money. You can still play for free it seems, but you may take much longer to achieve what a paid person could get in a day. 

As a free to play person though, I still think it's worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150961496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1591334177}
review:
At times one must commit one of the most difficult tasks known to man, 'reflect'.
What exactly am I doing with my life? Have I made any impact at all? Does my existence amount to anything? Anything at all? For most of us, most likely no. However, A simple distraction from all these feelings of 'worry', 'pain' or even 'quilt' is what can keep us, no, all of man from fading away to nothingness, leaving no trace of being behind.

Truly, Truly this game has improved my life in more ways than most minds could ever possibly fathom. I cannot describe how much I recommend this game to anybody, no matter your race, religion, or gender. Please, just play this game. It's effects on your life will be nothing but positive. I promise.

review: Okay, I play this on and off honestly the nice the nice thing is the game is kind of fun. However research in this game is a key element all your cards in your deck need it and once you start putting auto add on there your game of winning games can drop massively since you don't have the combos to back up your cards. A lot of combos are a 24 hour research time which blows since you have a card that has been decent drops on quality scale and is unnecessary anymore. The new card however has no research done so you can't do any combos and It honestly hurts your deck.

Peter please... please... I- I just wanna see my family again

peter kicks over the chair, smiling down at the malnourished quagmire as he squats over his face, the rotund spectacle blocking nearly all light as poor quagmire can only stare up at the now widening pucker of peter griffin

OPEEEN WIDEEEEE

BRRRAAAAPPPP PFFFRRRTFTFTF PPPPOOPPBBB SWEWWE PRRRRBBBT

PLOP POLOP BRRAAAAAPPPPP BBBREEEW PRRRREAAAAAPPPPP

BRREAPPPPPOPO POPPPFTTFTR

Mmmhmm yeah quaggy eat that shit! God I feel like when I met tom cruise that one time at the wheat convention! Oh FUCK quagga here comes the motherlode!

you can smell the rancid, rotting shit well before it even pokes its vile head from peters stretched hole, the godless log slowly pushes apart peters elastic pucker as it descends into the mouth of dear quagmire, it’s abhorrent, filthy smell choking the air, as the worm laden horror slips over quagmires teeth

author: {'steamid': '76561197961214315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1693957127}
review:
A garbage game that essentially feeds an addiction engine. Massively pay to win, monetized at every turn. Hearthstone and Magic: the Gathering look entirely reasonable and not at all deck based by comparison.

Everything is single card packs or slow unlocks. There is no direct crafting system. It values Mythic cards (if given the opportunity to buy outright through promo packs) at over $100 for a single card.

The game literally has a paid VIP option to help you NOT actually play the game and auto-battle everything at once for you.

As a F2P player on mobile after letting VIP expire it took over 8 months of daily play to get one Mythic object. One. One single Mythic object.

Fun references to the cartoons though and I'm pot committed so lets go baby!

Oh the game also heavily advertises PVP through Brawl, Rumble, and Siege but there is no actual PVP. You're never match-made or queued against anyone, it's all you vs. bot play of other people's decks. There is no interaction or PVP in the game.

review:
Wirklich sehr sehr geiles Game (auch am PC), hab´s schon immer bisschen aufm Handy gespielt und als ich es auf Steam entdeckt habe musste ich mal reinschauen. Woraufhin ich gemerkt hab das ich über den Kongregateacc meinen Spielstand vom Handy auf den PC transferieren kann, wirklich top.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998192372', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1691068147}
review:
Ein tolles und hervorragendes Kartenerlebnis.😊

Ihr begebt euch in die wunderbare Welt von Zeichentrick Ikonen aus American Day, Archer, Bob's Burgers, Family Guy, Futurama, Family Guy, King of the Hill& vielen weiteren Überraschungen die eure Kindheit bis heute prägt.🤭

Das ist toll das ihr Combos fusionieren könnt und dadurch neue Kartenmöglichkeiten aus der Kombination 2 verschiedener Karten freischalten könnt somit steht dem sammeln nichts im Wege.😬

Ach nicht das es schon alles ist habt ihr tolle Events an denen ihr teilnehmen könnt und dann dementsprechend bestimmte Münzen bekommt die ihr gegen Charakterfortschritt oder Boosterpacks eintauschen könnt.🪙

Dann ist das auch so spektakulär das ihr an den PVP Arenen teilnehmen könnt und direkt in die Que kommt weil dies nicht in Echtzeit stattfindet sondern ein automatischer Kampf gegen das Deck des anderen Spielers ist.🎴

Dann habt ihr die Möglichkeit euch durch Abenteuer durch eine kostenfreie Kampagnenwelt durch zu reiten und diese zu meistern. ✅

Das heißt im Abenteuer desto öfter ihr das Kapitel meistert desto toller werden die Belohnungen vorerst mit Bronze Belohnung, dann Silber Belohungen, dann Gold Belohnungen und dann lila Belohnungen, ich schätze mal das man jedes Level 12 mal meistern müsste um dieses auf lila zu meistern.📈

Nicht destotrotz möchte ich in der Hinsicht auch anbei erläutern das ihr auch innerhalb der Welt von Animation Throwdown Einkäufe mit Handelsinstrumenten wie Echtgeld (€, $, usw) tätigen könnt und es nicht so free-2- ist wie es scheint jedoch was solls die Musik ist Klasse und die Soundeffekte sind den Entwicklern auch gelungen.
🎼🎵

Ach ja einen Battle Pass gibt es auch für die jenen die etwas ohne Battle Pass nicht anfassen muhahaha.😬

author: {'steamid': '76561199043358625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 160145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143422, 'last_played': 1698903090}
review: This game has sucked up thousands of hours of my life that could have no doubt been spent more productively. I have given up on all forms of human contact and am contemplating wearing a diaper in order not to have my quest for cards interrupted by a weak bladder or impetuous bowel movement. I expect to die slowly while playing this horrible game that has hijacked my already largely atypical neural networks. This game has become a substitute for participating in the world as though truly alive as I was already a weak member of a tribe of one. I give it a thumbs up as I dare not perturb my animated friends due to coming to see them as having magical powers but I fear I may have already left my body and the world it had existed in. My only problem with this game is that I cannot lose once and for all and thus be annihilated as has become my deepest desire. The game runs my life and the cards are often too fickle. They have no mercy or sense of flexibility and context. The people who invented this game presumably returned to the hellish realm the emerged from through a cosmic porn star's unwitting fart that creates a gaseous portal every few millennia when the planets and the sun are appropriately aligned. They are apparently never available to attend to the angry cartoon gods' temperamental application of the rules the player expects to be dancing to during the ritualistic trap they have fallen into. At certain junctures the ebb and flow of the miserable struggle overtakes the slave with brutal imbalance that often leaves them weeping quietly. I am just glad I no longer have a job from which a source of money could be annexed by the parasitic colors on the screen. The chat has become a discord forum which is also completely substandard. If you have money do not give it up to this game. If I did not fear the angry cards I would complain about the ongoing bugs and occasional imbalances that are never fixed. Do not give up any money no matter how friendly the cards seem at the beginning. They will betray you in time...in time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035845005', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1706030977}
review:
Animation Throwdown has been the most entertaining TCG that I have played in a long time. The inclusion of some of my favorite animated shows (aka Cartoons) is a blast to see what they include for card combos. The different abilities that cards can have create just enough ability to customize decks without needlessly over convoluted rules and "infi-chains".

I started this on my mobile device and have recently synched my Kongregate account with my Steam version. The downside is that though you can rank high in items like "Card Master Challenge" there will always be a few who still (Pay to Win). But I have gotten to where I am, which I consider pretty respectable, with minimal monetary input. The game is totally playable and rewards you for your time investment and not only for your monetary investment.

I truly enjoy this title and it is the best TCG for me and my "casual" mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349857022', 'num_games_owned': 3008, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1279, 'last_played': 1665401673}
review:
[h1] Fun Crossover Card Game [/h1]

Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards is a pvp card game where you build a deck using cards from a variety of adult animated shows including Family Guy, Bob's Burgers, Futurama, American Dad, King of the Hill, and very recently added, Archer as well. These cards all have attack and defense stats as well as a variety of bonus effects, with the number and strength of them decided by the card's rarity. Cards can be combined to create more powerful cards, which need to be researched over real time. I know this may sound like the game is very pay to win then, and in some ways it is, but I got every achievement in this game without spending a dime and never felt like I had to pay money in order to compete with the players I was battling. It definitely takes time, but by logging in for the daily log in bonus, and doing your battles and completing quests, you get a lot of resources that can help you get a good amount of legendary cards. The battles aren't done in real time, just against real decks as far as I can tell, being controlled by the AI so battles move along at a nice fast pace, and you can speed them up even more if you want. I never felt like strategy was a big part of the game, more like whoever had better cards and more combinations they could play would win, so that was a bit of a shame, but it is important to have a good balance of cards in your deck. The cards are full of awesome references to the show and a large amount of characters and moments from them are highlighted here so fans of the shows will definitely enjoy seeing them and building a deck from their favorite show. If you don't mind a bit of a grind and want a nice little card game to spend some time in, I recommend this. It's not really a game you're meant to spend an hour playing every day, more like 15-20 minutes so I never felt like I had to pay, but paying will definitely help you progress faster. For more reviews, follow my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40795588/] curator page. [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198139299207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 112705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1332, 'playtime_at_review': 56594, 'last_played': 1712428026}
review:
Its a shame to have to write this but the reality is this game is a bad investment of your time let alone your money.  The developers are happy to push, rather aggressively, in game a lot of monetisation with various forced time consuming activities which you can "shorten" by giving them some money.  

You might think well fine they need to make money and I might agree but they dont care at all about the people playing the game.  They force you to log on to their servers to play but do not put any effort into maintaining those servers so you get kicked out constantly when you are trying to do things.  When I say constantly I mean you may get kicked 10 times in five mins, no joke.  Then they add updates to the game which literally break every single action in the game, clearly nobody could be bothered to do even 1 min of game testing before pushing the update out, that is how little they value the player base.  

It is honestly a shame because the IP's are well loved and the basic card game premise is fine but with the above the game is just a drag to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340361351', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 12527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12527, 'last_played': 1663191196}
review: Back in the day this game was great, very much pay to win but still very fun to play, i put a bit of money in to get slightly ahead of the curb, like 20 bucks, i became a top level player after a ton of grinding, had a very strong deck and held a very high pvp rating. i left it for a few years because i got burned out from the grind every free 2 play has, i returned today, remembering how fun it was, i played a bit of the pve to get back into it and went to play in the arena, my rank was still where it was at around 400 crowns, i played a bit, lost most of the games, as i expected, but i noticed everyone playing basically the same deck, there never was a real meta so i was surprised, but things change so i let the auto play ai play for me 50 times to get my rank to where it should be based on my deck after such a long time, not only did i loose all of my crowns but i went into rank 15, which i thought was really funny since i had a full legendary deck with a mythic, then i played some manually again and... they are all just standard hard difficulty bots, all of them, i noticed it right away because at this lower rank all of them played a defence card first, these cards do not actually exist for players, only bots can play them. so i thought a little bit and i guess it makes sense, instead of having long pvp matches, you can auto play a ton of them very quickly, this would not work if you where fighting real players. so instead thy give you a hard bot which copies a deck of a random player close to your rank, you give it a random name, random stats which match the average of the rank. a very smart system which worked so well it fooled me, since i never questioned it enough to think about it. but it broke since now there are no longer any active players, actually there are 63 active players, you can see on the leader boards for events. those player are all going to be the best of the best, so any rank below 16 the bots had to default back to their standard deck, since there are none to copy going around... and any bot above rank 16 will destroy you with the best decks which are copied from the best players. the thing about the ai, especially the harder ones is that, since they are pretty bad at thinking, they cheat... a lot. they don't randomly draw, they basically always get the best cards in the deck they play, so even a way stronger deck like mine can't defeat them more often than not if they have good bot decks, which they have, decks made by humans really did make them a lot worse, but giving them the best decks there are makes them unbeatable. i hereby declare this game as dead, because noone will want to play it when all there is to fight are unbeatable bots. it was nice to look at this game one last time and loosing my rank in the process, but id rather not play it any longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198835947091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 13517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6510, 'last_played': 1693614458}

author: {'steamid': '76561198376857926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1663146574}
review:
This isn't worth your time.

This is just a ported mobile game and it's not even a good port. There is an energy system for playing and a timer system for unlocks. It's kinda pay to win, someone with higher level cards than you will almost always win. Overall, this game is your typical mobile game that lacks any soul, just feels like a cash grab.

The only good things are that the references to the shows are pretty cool to see and the actual gameplay is pretty addicting and a little bit of fun. At most you should try this game out once if you're ever bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561199247780059', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1667414888}
review: Esse jogo é um clássico jogo de cartas, tem modos de jogo interessantes, muitos combos para descobrir e personagens clássicos, porem depois de um tempo fica bem enjoativo. O jogo é de graça, mas obviamente tem coisas pagas, esses coisas te ajudam a evoluir mais rápido, entretanto, surpreendentemente dá para jogar tranquilamente sem comprar nada com dinheiro. Fechando a analise, é um jogo legal com personagens legais, que depois de um tempo fica bem chatinho, se vc gosta desse estilo vai amar. se não gosta vai odiar (dã).

author: {'steamid': '76561198066314689', 'num_games_owned': 1921, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1679604531}
review:
This game crashes a lot on PC but can run on any phone? makes no sense the steam version should be the best version it has less micro-transactions than on mobile. Also this game could really use real time pvp instead of playing a bot with a friends randomized deck. The micro-transactions are mostly just time skippers and card packs its a shame this game wasn't seen more as free advertisement and less a cash cow I like the fusion mechanic and the references but I shouldn't have to fuse Chris with every alcohol just to learn it makes drunk Chris happy gaming 

also I would love to see the animation domination cart racer on apple arcade come to steam or consoles these fun characters deserve well scripted crossover interaction.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987388969', 'num_games_owned': 1737, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 5792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3709, 'last_played': 1700624491}
review:
Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards, is a deck building game, where you use your deck to play through a story-type mode, various battles and challenges against an AI opponent, as well as PVP against other players and in guild versus guild battles. You level up your cards, research combo's and mix and match your deck to your playstyle with various types of attacks, defenses, features, and abilities, from a variety of Adult Animation franchises such as; American Dad, Family Guy, Futurama, King of the Hill, Bob's Burgers, and so on. The combinations you research can be hilarious, typically a reference to something in one of the shows, and the variety of cards and combination possibilities makes the game fun and challenging.

The game allows pay to win through microtransactions, which I absolutely loathe, but as a funny little distraction for a few minutes a day, it can still be a fun game. If you like deck building games, or enjoy these shows, you might get a kick out of this game, if those things aren't your cup of tea, you probably won't like it as much. I don't typically go for these types of games, but I am a fan of these shows, and have enjoyed finding out what new and raunchy combo's I can unlock.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079740112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 4756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2710, 'last_played': 1664125921}
review:
Games pretty heavy on the pay to win. You can buy a lot of the best cards early. (Gold card)

In order to get decent rewards you have to pay for VIP.
 
Playing the campaign to get cards is time consuming with very little return add on you don't get a lot of good cards.

Good fusions take time, too much time, for two purple cards ( the most common best card you can get easily) to be fused, it takes two days. By the way you can buy time skips.

A lot of cards that you get are have bad base stats so almost always you have to upgrade them. First upgrades are pretty easy but later upgrades become really expensive and the better cards take even more. To even upgrade a card to its max you need to have multiple of the card along with truckloads of upgrade material. 


The best strategy to have is have a lot of fusions all with the highest color that you can get and maxing out each card. And you could do this easily if you just pay a lot of money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972610203', 'num_games_owned': 5647, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2020, 'last_played': 1674710236}
review:
Unless you REALLY like these shows that all once used to be fox properties, Futurama, King of the Hill, Bob's Burgers, Family Guy, and American Dad, then you probably won't like this game.

The essence oif it is its a card game where you can 'fuse' two cards together to get a new more powerful card. The kicker is, it takes a LOONG time to start building up a collection of purple quality cards, and me, 33 hours in at time of this review (with over 2 years of actual time having past), have no orange quality cards, the best. For a game that is built on getting multiple copies of the same card to upgrade them, this means you will probably have blue fusions better than your purple cards. Not to mention, researching a new fusion (cause yes they aren't automatic) every time you get a new purple card, is a 24 hour wait unless you have skips, which are very rarely given out as event rewards. At this point, I don't even play the actual card fusing game anymore. I log in, do my researches if it has been 24 hours, queueing up 2 cards fusions at a time, do my arena battles on auto battle, do my campaign nodes on autobattle for the completion rewards, and do any active events also on auto battle. I don't actually 'play' the game anymore. The only reason I'm still even bothering is because the last achievement I'm trying to unlock on steam is the PVP rank 15 achievement which has been taking an ungodly long time. I'm maybe halfway through rank 14 at this point.

I wouldn't recommend, it has novelty, but it gets old real quick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198405964681', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1656366388}
review:
El mejor juego de cartas que he podido experimentar en los últimos años, esto junto a una de las cosas que mas me encantan en la vida, las caricaturas y las animaciones, es un rotundo éxito tanto para fanáticos como para estrategas.

Algo que había criticado durante mucho tiempo es que este juego en sus años de lanzamiento era extremadamente freemium, con mucho énfasis en pagar por ganar o progresar en la arena y la historia, pero después de haber vuelto a instalarlo y conocer que existía una versión en Steam me volví a enamorar del sin fin de combinaciones, barajas y poderes especiales de los personajes con los objetos.

En tan solo el transcurso de casi 3 meses logré completarlo una vez más, lo cual es bastante bueno y un hecho a destacar al compararse con versiones anteriores, existen también nuevos medios de comunicación entre clanes y jugadores avezados que desean formar nuevas amistades, tan así que la adición de tener rifas y concursos semanales en Discord y dentro del juego es lo mejor que he notado en una comunidad decentemente grande.

Y lo mejor, con 5 grandes producciones animadas que aún logran sacarme una sonrisa cada vez que recuerdo sus escenas y gags históricos hechos cartas, es simplemente el complemento que tanto necesitaba para interesarme en lo que normalmente catalogaría como juego por turnos genérico.

10/10. ¡Con juegos de azar y mujerzuelas!

O maior contra? É MUITO pay to win. Mesmo. Então se quiser se divertir aceite que vez ou outra vai aparecer oponentes com decks muito superiores se não tiver afim de gastar.
Minha recomendação: Não gaste, não vale a pena, mas jogue mesmo assim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030334819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 245, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1653925185}
review:
Things I Dislike: 
- It's a mobile game: 
- You have 'energy' that prevents you from playing the game too much in one sitting? But it also comes back within a few hours? What is even the point of that
- The effort put in to microtransactions is telling. They have a store full of mtx's, reminders + pop-ups and multiple currencies etc. They have more options for purchase than they have actual in-game options in the settings menu. They're cashing in on the love of franchises without doing them much justice in return. 
- While the game is free-to-play, it's also a bit pay-to-win. You can buy card packs, with increasing rarity+price. 
- A game based upon great animated series that doesn't have many animated elements or good quality ones. 
- The back drops during matches are boring and some are noticeably low-res. 
- Much like a mobile game, they'll make it feel like you're earning enough to give you that little buzz and keep playing, but stepping back for a moment, you realise it's still going to take a long time. The ladder has a lot of steps, not all of them useful and the ladder is a very long, sometimes tedious, ladder. 
- 25 card deck minimum, 5 card hand, RNG. There have been matches I've lost because I solely didn't get any good cards out early enough. Then I'll retry and completely steamroll the opponent. The game isn't skill-based. 

Things I Like: 
+ Very easy to get into. Don't expect Gwent (which is where I'm coming from). Strategy comes down to getting your best cards in your hand (RNG), playing them sooner and keeping the other player from building up their side. Moves are solely 'Should I play another unit or upgrade a unit already played?' 
+ I came in here with one goal: Play Futurama cards only. And they make it easy to do so without making you feel like you're hindering yourself. You can always use other cards and mix decks but I did Futurama only and whenever I got a non-Futurama card, I could trash it and use the currency to upgrade the cards I already had. 
+ There where guilds in here called 'Glory to Ukraine'.
