author: {'steamid': '76561198162869111', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1495811667}
review:
[There was suppose to be a video me playing and reviewing it but OBS decided to be a b****rd (Apperantly This Is Bad Thing To Say) and record video like it was a livestream with bad signal]
I am from polish so if there was existance of these cartoon ones on polish i would know that. But even if i could knew them what they are or be fan of any these cartoons i would still write negetive review. Why? Well here is why:

I will start from the game the first thing this game is from phone game. Thats a stupid to do to relase game on computer that does the same thing like from phone but with mouse. The thing is that you have to wait for some min or hours to continue playing game because it has bar allowing you how much you can play it. Also computers are heavy as f**k and you must have power to play. "Boi how about laptop?" Dude you have a phone! USE IT!

The second thing Stable Internet Connection. Boi i am sure that mostly phones have stable connection enabled. To play it you must have internet connection or else you can say goodbye to game. If you have like bad connection then get away from this game. Its another stupid idea to have stable internet connection since you can play quest with bots. Cmon! Where is offline mode?!

Third Is Microtrasmictions [If i type wrong pls type in comments]. I understand some develepors wants to use money with it. But this game like the others ones has some stupid adding s**t items to buy it. Want alot of gem? Then go spend alot of hours of this game and try getting to 1000 with that tactic! Or you can just buy with real money to get lot of gems! Also i found that is best way to get best cards of it. MICROTRASMICTIONS LIKE THESE SHOULDNT EXIST!!!

And For My Opinion Fourth Reason is Difficulty. This Game Is Easy. You have only 1 turn to give a card anything you want. If you have best card combination ai will be so dead because they just keep putting same guy with lower hp than dmg. I beated 3 chapters without having to try again. The only fight was at 1-3 stage where i fight with kid again. 

So thats my problems with it. Well i wont ask if i recommend it or not since you saw my negetive review. If you are big fan of any of these cartoons then go get it. I am sure you will like it. If you dont like bad microtrasmictions, have bad connection, dont like to waste time because waiting, or HATE of these cartoons then avoid it. You will not like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042342817', 'num_games_owned': 1947, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 8280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7816, 'last_played': 1582148275}
review:
ok so i played the game. and for the most part it's fun to play. the one major thing in my oppinion is the cost to play and upgrade at a decent pace. you can play completely free. how ever the game almost forces you to buy if you need to upgrade. with out putting lots of money into this game, it will take forever to build up a decent deck. i bought $5 into this game. and after i got what i paid for. i really felt kind of ripped off. $5 didn't really do change much. could barely upgrade any cards. though the game in it's self is fun, i can not recommend it because of the money demand on the game making it pretty much pay to win.

PROS:
runs good
fun to play

CONS:
combo research: some of these take up to 48hrs to learn. and when you have to learn all combo's. this makes the game a very long upgrade and deck build process.

charactor tokens: very hard to get when you need them for achievements. 

lack of use for gold: only 2 things you can spend gold on. packs and rotating charactor tokens when pvping.

this game is fun for the most part and it is f2p. how ever to get anywhere in the game with in a decent amount of time. you will need to invest tons of money. making this game to me a cash sink, because wht you get for the money invested isn't much when compared to other games of simular cash transactions. 

if they fix this and make it not so expensive to upgrade and progress a little faster and not such a money sink. then i will change my review on it.

edite:
just found another con about this game. got a ssd and needed to reinstall steam. go to reinstall this game. installed great, but lost my game i was working on and had put money into it. and now after reinstalling, i have to start all over from scratch. lost all invested money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119981980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1207, 'last_played': 1494876110}
review:
Que dire ? Ce jeu est une bonne idée, fun, amusant quand on connait les univers. 
Cependant ce jeu peut sembler facile au début, mais très vite il va se compliquer à un point où on a juste l'impression de se faire cracher dessus. On ne joue pas contre d'autres joueurs, pour preuve l'avantage que l'adversaire aura au bout d'un moment avec une carte épique directement sur le terrain ... Le mode aventure bug concernant les quêtes des maîtrises sur les îles et vers la fin, tu tombes contre des personnages qui ne possèdent que 2 cartes en plusieurs exemples, donc son jeu se limite à un combo ultra fort, aucun intérêt. 

Vous pouve mettre au placard la stratégie, y'en a peu, c'est juste mettre la carte la plus forte, donc payer pour avec des chances d'avoir ces cartes. Car l'achat de boosters avec la monnaie du jeu va vite te cracher dessus (lol l'aléatoire). 

En conclusion, c'est gratuit, donc amusez vous la petite semaine où ca va vous amuser mais après ça passera vite. De plus, il est plus intéressant de jouer sur le site de l'éditeur plutôt que sur steam à cause du bonus des pubs. C'est dommage de gâcher une bonne idée par l'attrait du gain (encore).

author: {'steamid': '76561197997910178', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1504722307}
review:
Been playing the game a long time on my phone, and after the more recent changes, there is just no competitiveness for a true F2P player in this game anymore.  
Everything is randomized to heck now, no farming, and all guarnateed rewards are behind paywalls or requiring you to place in, very often, top 25 which is naught but impossible without spending cash.
It was fun, still is so-so for me, but it's becoming more of a chore than a game.
I would not recommend this to any new players unless they expect to spend 100$ or more to gain even a small ounce of competitiveness, unless ofc they're insanely lucky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125639970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1622402506}
review:
This is a neat little game with a few of my favorite cartoon groups in it. I am not much of a CCG player but when it comes to Family Guy, Futurama, and American Dad you cant go wrong.
After some good amount of time spent playing I figured it was time to put my two thoughts out there about this game. 

1: Like most games of this style, its more of a money grabber in poor taste. Honestly, you really do not need to spend a dime let alone the prices they ask for. Be patient and enjoy some idle time playing. 
2: I do find alot of the playable combos funny to see and laugh when something you least expect to show up.

Now the pros and cons... first the Congress Section
-Hero token system is a joke and comes close to making this game not worth playing. Far too random and yes you can spend some of you coins to find a pvp match that MAY reward tokens for the hero you want but still it is less likely to reward you at all with any tokens.
-Combo research times are a bit too much. I understand they do not want you to find them easily but waiting over 24 hours for the higher tier combos is a bit much.
-Questing system is what you would expect.. tasks in hopes of your constant returning. Nothing too exciting and like other games of this style ordinary and far too common.

Progress Section-
-It has some funny quotes new and old (meaning from their shows) you can tell they put forth some thought to what may seem a bit random but definitely quirky sayings.
-Cards are all based off of the shows from commong to epic levels. Which is good for those of us who have watched every season and episode religiously. (Well except for Bob's Burger and King of the Hill, I dont know much about that them.)
-Free to play (long as you do not fall into their money hungry schemes)

All in all, if you want a game to pass time away I would suggest this is a pretty good one. I would only advise not to waste your hard earned money on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972308098', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1561502386}
review:
This game contains every one of the worst F2P mechanics you see infesting mobile games.

1) Energy Bars? Check

2) Timers? Check

3) Gacha gambling? Check

4) Star levels where anything but the highest is worthless? Check

5) Card levels where anything but the highest is worthless? Check

6) PvP where the winner is whoever spends the most money due to 2, 3, and 4 above? Check

It's free to try out, so go right a head, just expect to hit all those walls rather quickly. I'd keep your wallet closed, no sense supporting these kinds of monetization models.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063656437', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11, 'playtime_at_review': 2664, 'last_played': 1711679859}
review:
Pros:
- Favourite anime/cartoon TV SHOW characters. 

Cons :
- No strategy opportunities everything is completly random.
- No trading with friends opportunities.
- Annoying time limit + cool down.  THAT DON'T BELONG ON A PC GAME!!!
- PAY TO WIN!!!
- The higher you get in the Arena the worse cards they draw for your deck.
Meaning this won't allow you to master any skill or strategy.

This is a straight mobile port to pc.
I won't recommend this game, I bet there are better card collect games out there.
Heartstone comes to mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090208001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1217, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1497357241}
review:
Отличная мульти вселенная в карточном сегменте, не хватает Лишь карт по мотивам "Симпсонов", и "Южного Парка".

Очень занятная механика  ведения боя, и поведения карт на столе, для карточной игры очень даже здорово, самое главное продуманно.

Хороший дизайн карт, играя ты вспоминаешь просмотренные серии несколько лет назад, и аж слеза ностальгии наворачивается упасть  на твою клавиатуру, но ты держишься.  

Фанатам мультфильмов точно стоит попробовать эту карточную игру. 

И конечно же фанатам карточных игры, кем я и являюсь.

Играю в основном колодой из мультфильмов Гриффины, Футурамы, ибо более теплее отношусь к этим мультфильмам. 

Всем приятных боев.

Желаю всем не стареть душой, и смотреть только хорошие мультфильмы.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164134080', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1496161053}
review:
C'est un bon jeux, il vaut mieux jouer a la version mobile de celui ci avec quelque avantage non négligable.

Le moins, pas de reel pvp entre joueurs donc on peu douter de partie gagner et perdu, je pense que les calcul de probabilité de sortir les bonnes cartes sont calculer bien avant la partie. Donc jeux à ce mefier.
Ce jeux fait partie des jeux pay to win, mais comme tout bon paye to win peu etre jouer sans payer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013090955', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1495743187}
review:
Карточки заколебешься выбивать.

+:
1) бисплатна
2) можно рубиться с телефона
3) синхронизация игры с разных устройств
4) донат можно свободно миновать (пiдоры орут "payTOwin", это вранье)
5) стабильно идет
6) Луиза Бэлчер есть (Bob's Burgers)
7) не занимает много времени (можете продолжать смотреть котиков в своей любимой соц. сети, ты - бот)
8) порт с телефона (но технически ОК)

-:
1) ПСЕВДА АНЛАЙН (ублюдки обманывают; против меня играл друг, КОГДА Я БЫЛ ОФФЛАЙН!!!!!!!)
2) гильдии абсолютно бесполезны
3) карты крутые вы заколебетесь выбивать, если без вложений баксов
4) почему-то игра требует онлайн соединение, НО ВЕДЬ ОНА ЖЕ ОФФЛАЙН по сути (прямого соединения между игроками нет)
5) где Симсаны а?
6) убогое музыкальное сопровождение
7) можно было добавить голоса персонажам, скучно (тут под комиксы закос)
8) долгая начальная загрузка (почти GTA5)
9) надоедающие бесконечные награды, которые призывно мотивируют игрока (но сейчас почти любая игра "награждает" игрока даже при проигрыше; в чем смысл этого бесконечного поощрения? или игроки современные настолько уё*****, что теряют интерес к игре, если их не хвалят 3 раза за 4 секунды?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198149571755', 'num_games_owned': 4, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1495084902}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969903139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1495156581}
review:
POSTÉ LE : 9 MAI
Oui...c'est un Pay-To-Win...mais cela ne nous empêche pas de nous y amuser. Comprenez-le plutôt comme le fait que payer peut nous procurer de sacrés avantages matériels et de temps, mais que si vous jouez pour le fun, ce n'est heureusement pas indispensable.

Pour commencer, je pense que pour apprécier Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards, il faut tout d'abord apprécier l'une ou plusieurs des séries qui font l'intérêt du jeu, à savoir Family Guy (les Griffin), American Dad, Futurama, Bob's Burgers et King of the Hill. Sinon, le jeu n'a que très peu d'intérêt...

author: {'steamid': '76561198216407355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 25445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3747, 'last_played': 1498514765}
review:
normally i i listen to reviews and when i write them i mostly give bad reviews
i am not a hard core card game player but i have tried a few

that said this is a light hearted fun game i have played 2 days solid
it has depth stratagy some randome factors so you cant just figure it out and own it
and humer combining cards to see images from shows you would remember

when i say the game has depth you cant just log in use cheat engine and rape every one 
there are combos need to be unlocked with timers so choosing what combo to unlock next is vital to your stratagy
the matchs because of the randome cards you get means you can be owned one match and own the next 
or may decide to redo your whole deck to suit the challenge 

its free sure you can buy your way to the top but i have not seen anything yet that means a loyal player cannot beat a pay to play player with a little hard work time and stratagy 

lastly did i mention the game is fun so try it if you like it its worth every penny if you love it you can buy stuff and put the hurt on us free bee players but ether way you will not find your self being used as cannon fodder for paying players the balance keeps it a light hearted game as it should be three thumbs up

author: {'steamid': '76561197995141366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1495082782}
review:
have you ever felt like you are seeing something really beautifull and then the closer you get to it you realise that all it was was pure concentrated bullshit? well that is how i feel right now.

the game has no strategy involved what so ever, to win you need to put money in the game to upgrade your card witch give you card hp and cause of that ppl who put money will rekt you all the time because all you have is  a card with 4 attack and 4 hp and maybe a rare card with 12h and 2 attac while he have 6 attack and 34 hp... it would of been a lot better if the game has a systeme like mtg with balance and you pay to get booster pack that still would keep the game balance but nooo they screw up

author: {'steamid': '76561198028038495', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1826, 'last_played': 1496198866}
review:
Alrighty, so I've got 30.4 Hours into this in 2 weeks. I spent $5, mostly out of "Well, I played for 30 hours, I owe them SOMETHING."

What I don't owe them, is a positive review. 

There should be a "I don't want to play with people who spend more than $10 on this game" mode, because I've hit that wall 30 hours in. Warframe has shown me that F2P can be amazing, if done right. This game does it all wrong. After your first few times leveling up (which each time fills your energy bars, so there's no breaking, if you don't want to) you'll start to see just how much money you could end up spending if you don't stop the bright flashy lights and ding-ding winner-winner-chicken-dinner sound effects that this game throws your way for every little thing. It's by design, and it's fucked up. I don't care that "That's how it's done", it's fucked up.

Congrats on getting $5 out of me. I mean, I did play it for 30 hrs, so I owe you that much at least, but rest assured, I am uninstalling this cash grab and never touching it again.

I'd advise you to just step away, and go play Hearthstone, instead. Even if you don't like Warcraft, and you LOVE these characters (grew up on FG and Futurama) this game is still an emmense waste of your time, your money, and the frustration of trying to figure out why King of the Hill is even in this, and why Archer isn't. Seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 809, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1495010969}
review:
Animation Throwdown is another Pay to Win card game based on the smashup of 5 different American TV shows. The shows are Family Guy, Futurama, American Dad, Bob's Burgers and King of the Hill.

The objective of the game is to race to knock your opponent's lifepoints to 0 before they do it to you. The gameplay is fairly simple. You have a hand of 5 cards and you choose 1 to play on your turn. You either play it on the field or combine it with a card in your hand/field. When you play it on the field, it cannot be activated yet, similar to summoning sickness in Magic the Gathering. When you combine 2 cards, the combo needs to be researched first. At the end of your turn, you draw back up to 5 cards. The game keeps on going until one player runs of life points. 

Conclusion, you may skip this P2W game. It is a plethora of money sinking methods that have been used for the gaming market. The only one that they are currently missing is Gachapon. The best price is 10,000 gems + 500 Mythic Stones for $99.99.

Notes: This is a collaboration by Fox Digital Entertainment, Synapse Games, Chinzilla and Kongregate.

[h1][b]PROS[/b][/h1]
1. Semi-interesting sauce
Some of the shows are interesting in real life.

[h1][b]CONS[/b][/h1]
1. Pay To Win
Gems, Mythic Stones, Gigittywatts, Legendary Stones. The best price is 10,000 gems + 500 Mythic Stones for $99.99. Use the gems to buy upgrades for your cards and bypass the Gigittywats grind. Starter pack costs $4.99 for 800 gems, 100 Gigittywats, 5 Energy Refills,1 L5 Professor Farnsworth, 1 L1 Paintball with Guns, 1 L1 Manger Babies

2. Super Rarity Creep
The cards are tiered into Common (Grey), Rare(Green), Epic (Blue), Legendary (Purple) and Mythic (Gold). Legendary cards have way superior stats compared to a Common. E.g. 4/10 Legendary to 4/4 Common

3. Designed to be a Time Waster
Want to do a combo? Research it for 24 hours. You need to buy a Research Accelerator for $9.99 to boost the research. Want a larger Adventure Energy Cap? Pay $9.99 to boost the Adventure Energy Cap by 25. 

4. Game Mechanic Paywalls
Want more inventory space and add 50 card slots? Pay 250 Gems.

5. Crafting
1000 Mythic Stone to craft 1 Mythic Card. A Mythic card is just 1 OP card that helps you win the game. You can also look for 250 fragments and spend 5000 coins on crafting a Mythic too.

6. Upgrading and Fusion
WTF? Use Gigittywats to upgrade the cards and then fuse 2 cards of the same name and level together for the next upgrade? How much time wasting is this?

7. Bad Connections
Game always disconnects mid-game due to "Slow Connection" error.

8. Research Combos
Another WTF? In order to combo your cards, you have to research them first. Common Combs take 1 hour, Rare Combos take 8 hours. You can imagine how long more it would be for the Mythic ones.

[h1][b]NEUTRAL[/b][/h1]
1. Automated Combat
While I am typing this review, the game is playing itself. All I have to do is turn on automated combat. While this is a stupid feature to put in the game, I realise there is a benefit to automation. Thus, I am neutral on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970548935', 'num_games_owned': 11902, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1543894868}
review:
This isn't even pay2win, this is pay2bore if anything.

Game progress gets super slow around level 25 in the Adventure or level 10 in Arena, you can see that even raising the Adventure Energy Cap would shift this only up another 5 levels or so, since the crucial levelling up of your avatar happens in the Arena. There is simply no incentive to spend the gems, since all useful stuff is cash. 

A single arena refill for 10 matches costs USD4 or more (400 gems)! What's even more laughable is, that you get about an arena refill a day, or two, for watching an ad as well on mobile, while none of this exist in the steam desktop version. 
This would work for a no-math-involved game, but here, the core of the game is to compare numbers, so the whole incentive system is off by a factor of five at least.

Research doesn't even matter that much, since due to the temporal trait bonus system, you only need to develop a few combos with the trait to dominate there as well.

Challenges are a way too grindy (even with auto resolve) to get to the competitive levels as well and have equally laughable rewards. The team brawl disappeared altogether for the last days.

It's really sad to see Fox's IP wasted like that. The story dialog is actually not that bad, the aggressive game state syncing also enables seamless transition between mobile and desktop.

Also with the share kongregate gets, they are still unable to change a username I settled for 10+ years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 32929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32630, 'last_played': 1656590732}
review:
Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards is a multi-platform Free to Play CCG.  It worked on Win 10, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok.  Animation Throwdown is a card collecting game incorporating five Twentieth Century Fox Television animated comedies: American Dad!, Bob’s Burgers, Family Guy, Futurama, and King of the Hill.  Game is also on Kongregate, IOS and Android.  Gameplay is similiar to other free to play CCGs, but has some different features.  You have a deck with a limit of 35 cards, which give you enough chances to get the cards you want out.  PVP arena is the only place where you can level up your deck hero and unlock other deck heroes, you get random chances of receiving xp for a random hero.  The game is Pay to Win so don't expect to win much verses a P2W player, if you don't Pay or didn't grind it like a job.  Do link your steam account for this game to the Kongregate website, so you can also play from the website.

PRO:
- Has Consecutive daily login reward system that give out resources and items that help F2P players out ( including Mythic stones, 8hr research speedups, arena beers, gems, gigitybits, golden turds, hero token, legendary stones.)  
- Has a Daliy quest that rewards gigitybits and gems, that is easy enough for everyone to do.
- Has some funny sayings, but some have colorfull langauge.
- Great graphics that looks like the media it is based on.
- Fans of the five comedies will find something to like here.
- Looks like you can play the game for a while free if you have patience, willpower, and smarts.
- You can get 1 random card for 1000 in-game money, you earn quite a lot of this currency.  There are other currencies you can earn by playing to buy card packs.
- You can get more cards for rewards from PVE campaigns, event rewards, PVP rewards.
- If you know what you are doing, you might win more matches.
- Has a simple tutorial to get you started.
- Has PVE events to play through, separate from your energy limit, the energy recharges the fastest with PVE campaign.
- Has 30 PVE campaign tiers with 3 opponents each that can be played again to advance the difficulty of Bronze, silver, gold, black.  Each get progressively higher difficultly as you go up in number.  Some have set decks that you have to figure out how to beat.
- Has guilds that provide buffs to members, and guild vs guild battles that give more rewards.
- Has auto-battle toogle using  AI and speed increase toggle and instant complete button and surrender match button. 
- Has asynchronous PVP with ok matchmaking, when you increase your win streak your chances of getting matched to a P2W player increases.
- PVP opponents is AI bots using the player's deck, no real PVP and no bad sportmanship.
- You can reroll your opponent in PVP arena by paying 100 pennys, and you can look at their hero details. so if you notice a hard player you can skip them. 
- You can practice battle with players in PVP arena and with other guild members.
- Match conditions change over time, called Battleground Effect, changes every month.  


CONS:
- Is Pay to Win, since there is PVP between players and what you can buy in the store can give you an advantage over players that don't spend money or as much money as you spent.  
- Players that started playing at the Startup of the game, Will have the advantage over everyone else.
- The chances of getting the cards that you want and need are lousy.  You will have to make do with what you got.
- You are limited to holding 200 cards in your inventory at start.  Have to buy 50 card upgrade for 250-500-750-? gems.  You will be spending your earned gems on increasing your inventory space.  You need your inventory space to hold all the cards you get to make the various builds needed for various match conditions. 
-  You will be making hard choices on what cards to destroy for upgrade resources and free up inventory space.
- Some card combos are overpowered.
- Some deck builds are overpowered.
- Some cards are overpowered.
- Has PVP, so there will be matches you lose just from bad matchup with higher level or P2W player.
- Does not have in-game Help.
- The auto-battle AI misses better moves than what an knowledgable player would do with their deck.
- Has many progressively increasing timers and energy system, so you might have to stretch your playing out.
- Free to Play Players will take a long time to earn enough points to get just 1 Mythic card, need Mythic cards to compete with P2W players.
- Game Not for young children, has some bad language.
- Game does not have chat built into it, you chat through the Kongregate website.
- Steam cloud does not work on this game.

Try it, maybe you might like it. 

For more info:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PgLHEXd3pes

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s-Gxn0e-hHI

Игра приятная в локализации и анимации можно с удовольствием потратить несколько часов но это будет все зря. Донат просто ужасен ты не сможешь раздобыть легендарную или мифическую карту просто играя их нужно только покупать. При этом комбо карт происходят очень долго ускорить можно сново спомощью доната. author: {'steamid': '76561198044285020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1494799217}
review: Сыграл в игру около 2х часов, парился побеждал и проходил. Перезашел и весь прогресс стерт и это учитывая что игра мнопользовательская и только онлайн и данные храняться на их сервере. То есть, эти дураки заставили после перезапуска перепроходить всё от и до, я думал что это только туториал но это не так, весь прогресс, все карты, уровень, иследования - всё полетело.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046042990', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1494798813}
review:
[h1]HearthStone для фанатов FamilyGuy[/h1]
В каратце это колекционно карточная игра, портированная с мобильных устройств на пк с героями мультсериалов 2x2 (Американский папаша, FamilyGuy, Футурама и др)  в главной роли. Цель игры собрать колоду из имеющихся карт, что бы начистить лицо противника (снизить его хелс поинты до нуля).
Для фанатов вышеперечисленных сериалов отличная казуальная игрушка (займет 20-30 минут в день), с необязательным для успешной игры донатом.
Для фанатов HearthStone слишком простая и глупая.
Подробный обзор дальше по ссылочке: http://telegra.ph/HearthStone-dlya-lyubitelej-FamilyGuy-05-14

author: {'steamid': '76561198386433978', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1518722902}
review:
ok, this is one of the funniest games i have played in a while. it is funny, short and has a very addictive card game system. the game is balanced and has several quirks that help keep it ffresh and innovative. the combo system is a great way of showing off the humor of the shows that the game is based off of and esearching new ones keeps the game fun and fresh.
I have only seen one of the shows shown in this game (futurama) but have seen the humor shown in the other four (family guy, king of the hill, american dad and bob's burgers) and am considering checking them out. 4.5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198105977901', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5359, 'last_played': 1662118256}
review:
Ok, now i'm not one to do negative reviews, but I just need to get this out of the way right now. Animation Throwdown just blows entirely. I had fun for a few times, but now, i'm just getting tired of it and it has shown no change of being more fun at all. Here's my gripes about the game:

1: The adventure mode just gets tedious, not just because of the battles getting harder, it's just that when you lose for the amount of tries you have, you have to wait for it to recharge, which I am not fond of at all, especially when you want to try and grind to get the rare cards you want to fusion with the other card to have it become better.

2: Daily quests doesn't even cut it to giving you something worthwhile, just coins... that's it. Too cheap to give the players something good like some gems or something else, but instead we get coins. Editing this, the Daily Quest reward gives you some gems so I guess i'll let that slide a bit.

3: The arena is not fun, it's just boring. It could be better if they made it a little more different, but no they didn't. Not to mention the stupid defense cards they give them when you start a battle, unneccesary and just really annoying in most cases. They helped it by having getting coins and such more helpful by achieving win bonuses each time you win, but it still does get pretty annoying to wait for the arena energy to fill especially when you barely get enough "win crystals" to become higher in the tiers for better rewards.

4: Pay to win BS. I HAAAATE Pay to win games, they drive me insane with it's annoyingness. Animation Throwdown is a great example of that annoyingness. First off, you have to pay a outragious amounts of money in order to get a hell of a lot of gems, not to mention as well as getting giggitywatts. Secondly you have to waste adventure energy in order to go back and get a better card, i.e the rare cards which sucks more, not to mention that you ALSO have to pay a lot of gems just to reload it. and then finally, you don't even get anything special like any celebratory reward of stuff like that, but no just COINS!!!

5: The challenges aspect. When you of course beat a computerized apponent in a different challenge you get a level +#, each time you win you bump up the level. HOWEVER, this also bring to the point of being absolute aggrivating when you lose and they lower that level by -3, THAT PISSES ME OFF!!! Reason why is because you go through so much damn work just to lose -3 levels and go down tier after tier after tier (little warning, it gets more annoying) and end up with not really great rewards and just mostly epic stones. Now I am greatful that they didn't do that for the Swole Challenges because they espect you to not get that far since they become too OP furthur (don't know how to spell it) in the level so good on ya for that, but WHY NOT HAVE THAT FOR THE OTHER CHALLENGES?! Oh let me guess "it'll be too easy", not if you balance the gain and loss for the levels you get to make it more fair. The challenge where the AI uses only their legendary cards are fine, but the other ones don't cut it for me. Just make it more fair and you'll be golden.

6: The mythical card add. Now I don't espect you guys at KongStaff to make getting the mythical stones easy because the mythical cards are really f-ing good. But if it was possible, try and make it to where you can at least earn percentages of the card's gauge by at least doing a few arena matches maybe like for e.g, when you beat like 20 matches you get like a random amount for the mythical card, it can be less too, just at least make it to where you can get a random amount from that, you don't have to do it though, just a suggestion.

7: The biggest thing everybody and I mean EVERYBODY has been talking about, is the Simpsons thing. Out of the shows you put in: Family Guy, American Dad, Futurama, Bob's Burgers, and King of the Hill you chose to not put in The Simpsons considering they have been on FOX waaay more than Bob's Burgers have. No hate on Bob's Burgers, but that show is no way really famous to have a spot to be in this game and the fact that The Simpsons could be in this. This is a really big thing a lot of people want and they should recieve it because having Simpsons in this could really have some great ideas for cards and combinations revolving around The Simpsons as well, not to mention, I feel that putting Bob's Burgers or King of the Hill into the game instead of The Simpsons is just insulting to me at least. So KongStaff I ask you, please put The Simpsons in, it would make the game for me and everyone else who wants The Simpsons in great and happy.

There's a little more that I can say about this game, but I think I covered as much as I can handle. When I first saw this game go on steam I was like "YES, FINALLY!!" and when playing it for a period amount of time, I just gave up. I doubt this will happen, but if there was any chance that people is going to hack the steam version of this, then I won't feel ashamed at all, considering the amount of money and shit that you have to pay in order to get better stuff, yeah I won't feel nothing for hacking this game.

Point is I used to like this game and now I don't. Try it for yourselves if you want, I won't stop you, but the ones who want my honest choice for you, don't even bother playing this game, nothing good will come out of this.

This is an edit that I want to put out. So with the KongStaff updating the game to have a new challenge and a log in bonus, it would also great to make a really big update and put in The Simpsons. I already established why you should put them in, but I want to say again, as a fan, to put in The Simpsons, it would make a lot of people happy, trust me KongStaff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166311646', 'num_games_owned': 1022, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 12428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12428, 'last_played': 1663830034}
review:
[quote=Leon (Не Кеннеди)] Изначально мертворожденная игра. [/quote]
Как бы я не любил все эти мультфильмы, как бы я не давал этой игре шансы, но, спустя очень большое количество потраченного на нее времени я понял – это никуда не годится.
[h1] От себя [/h1]
Я безумно обрадовался когда-то тому, что наткнулся на эту игру. Сама игра бесплатная, карточка, так и еще по моим любимым мультфильмам, чем не круто? Однако было чем. Хоть в игре и присутствует очень большой арсенал карт, причем из каждого сериала, но весь смысл этих карт, постройки колоды и прочего теряется из-за одной простой проблемы – эта [b] [i]  игра напрочь лишена онлайн поединков. [/i] [/b]
И на самом деле я понимаю почему. В игре есть навыки, которые тяжело применить в онлайн поединках, т.к. они или сразу же предвещают твое поражение, или же наоборот, выглядят максимально слабыми или глупыми. Однако это все можно было бы исправить, выпуская патчи, как на любой другой онлайн игре, но имеем, что имеем.
Я провел достаточно времени в этой игре, создавая свою отличную колоду карт для сражений на арене, вот только арена - это не онлайн поединок. Со временем я это понял, и соответственно я начал терять к игре, может и к лучшему, потому что убивать время можно и в любой другой игре.
А если вы хотели бы сыграть в бесплатную карточную игру, то таких игр пруд в пруди, но эту лучше обходить стороной. Ну или не обходите, если вас не останавливает такой жирный минус игры.

review: First off if your playing free to play ofcousre it's expected to spend few bucks to get ahead. Secondly, I recomend VIP for 10$. It will help you move ahead and make drastic strides to better cards. Third, Play PVP and adventure. Pvp is serious coins 600+ a win. With cards being 1k a pop I save to 10 k or so and usually make out with rare cards atleast 3/10. Upgrades are a must and dont waste gems on research like I did. spend it on 250 gem pack wich contain atleast one epic. The game is fun and I hope to see more expansions soon. It means you must spend 5$ to help... I'm A lover of american cartoons and this is by far to fun and brings back memories of old reruns. Good luck and git r dun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109077728', 'num_games_owned': 2448, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1500068398}
review:
Okay, so let's see, I shall list a few pros and cons

pros~
Favourite TV show characters collected as cards
Fun for a few minutes
I'm sorry, I can't really find any other pros >.<

KSO NOW THE BEST PART

CONS~
P2W
Missing a lot of other TV shows, for example 
*Rick and Morty
*The Simpsons
*South park
*I can't really think of anything else at the moment, but seriously, I have a point xD
Timers, timers and even more timers, basically trying to get combos will take you a long time, especially if the cards are rare and up, a whole day for an epic combo? Uhm, what? That's insane
You have to put a lot of time and effort into a game where you might not even advance to a point that feels satisfying because everything is corrupted and the people who have been playing this game for ages always get the best rewards
Not really a good port from mobile to PC for Steam, this should have been a browser or mobile game instead of them trying to make even more money on Steam
Maybe if they made the waiting hours less and made it more fair towards everyone, I would actually spend money on it
I made a purchase for the starter pack only to find out the cards I received, (which would have given me a small advantage), can be obtained in adventure mode, I feel like if you spend money on a game it should give you EXCLUSIVE ITEMS
Bugs, bugs and even more bugs, seriously, the developers need to work long and hard to make this game a Steam standard where players will actually have something positive to say about it
You have to unlock a rank before getting a certain character regardless of the amount of character shards you have? First time I've ever seen this -.- Like, wot?

Overall, I enjoyed this for the first day and then became super annoyed with the interface and it felt cheap, a lot of features felt really unfair to me and it is almost like I am not encouraged to put time and effort into this game, it will take way too long to get to where I want to be thanks to the cancerous waiting hours

If you enjoy grinding like a mofo for no reward and just because you're plain bored or something, I definitely recommend this, if you want a fun card game that offers rewarding game play, avoid at all costs.

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198370496982', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 990, 'last_played': 1670187137}
review:
dit is een leuke tcg maar je moet wel geduld hebben.
alles is met timers maar ondanks dat mensen zeggen dat dit een p2w game is ben ik het er niet mee eens.
je kan namelijk alles gratis krijgen door middel van qeusts en matches alleen duurt het erg lang.
aangezien de meeste jongere spelers die geduld niet kunnen opbrengen zeggen ze al gauw dat dit een p2w spel is.
voor de rest is dit wel een spel met een goed balans want je vecht voornamelijk tegen spelers van jou niveau ( niet niveau van het karakter) een nadeeltje wat er ook is , is het levelen van de karakters dit duurt wel lang doordat je ze in arena moet verdienen. kaarten kan je verbeteren door dezelfde kaarten te combineren met dezelfde level.
daarom als je geduld heb en van een leuke kaartspel hou raad ik het je zeker aan, heb je dit niet dan is dit spel niks voor je

author: {'steamid': '76561197993528752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 62563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2355, 'last_played': 1532882794}
review:
Addictive. 

As usual, f2p and p2w options are available. I have to say that it is quite easy to form a basic deck as f2p, but once the main adventures are farmed and quests done, there will be a wall against further advancements for quite some time. Still, a fun game that is easy to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151609324', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1495020169}
review: Игра, как карточная стратегия, неплоха. Привликает внимание картами с перонажами из всемилюбимых анимационных ситкомов. Лично мне игра понравилась. Единственный недостатки это не удобное управление и возможность купить ВСЁ за реал. Без денег долго развиваться.

review:
Didn't play long and if you want to see gameplay I'll link my video below. Basically this is a Spellstone reskin.(which I've played my fair share of on mobile) So if you've played Spellstone you've played this. Made by the same developer and publisher as Spellstone. As with Spellstone this game is Pay to Win if you want to be competitive. 

If you want something to waste time or don't care about how you compare to others then sure play it. I love the Fox based I.P.s and aesthetic that this offers. But again, if you want to be competitive be prepared to lay down cash.

https://youtu.be/WEIi72YDK5Q

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3471, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1494183932}
review:
Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards ist ein Free-to-Play Kartentaktikspiel. Es verarbeitet diverse Comicserie wie zB Futurama, American Dad, etc. und verwendet ein schon aus zahlreichen anderen ähnlichen Spielen bekanntes Spielsystem. Spielerisch ist es dadurch recht einfach gehalten und im Vergleich zu komplexeren Kartentaktikspielen wie zb Hearthstone, Magic the Gathering, Might & Magic Duel of Champions etc. ohne die dort zu findende strategische Tiefe. Der Reiz für Spieler hier dürfte vor allem in der Comicserien-Lizenzen liegen, da bekannte Charaktere aus den Serien als Bilder verwendet werden, entsprechende Sprüche zu lesen sind und eben der Humor der Serien nachgeahmt werden soll. Insgesamt gesehen sticht es dann auch nur durch diesen Hintergrund hervor, ansonsten spielerisch eher "Massenprodukt" ohne es böse zu meinen. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qaSCGFNF9uw

author: {'steamid': '76561198030495127', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1582400836}
review:
Sub-par CCG that basically lives on its brand recognition.  It's not horrible; it's just not very good, either.

The main gameplay is relatively simple; either play a new card (character or item), with health and damage and maybe a special ability or combo one type onto another to increase these stats and sometimes add a new abillity.  The card then attacks the card opposite it and the player if it does enough damage to break through or no card is there.

The problem is that this is usually a snowball effect- once someone gets two or three good combo cards with the right abilities, it's hard to get something to defend against them.  You can get the combined cards as well, but this means less chance of drawing a character or item that can be comboed with things for a single effect instead.

This gameplay happens in two basic game types, either against an AI deck (challenges and story mode) or player decks (arena and guild rumbles).  The game has quite a few tutorials and early achievements to start bulking up the various currencies you use to play most of the game modes.  These do regenerate on a timer, and there's a pretty large abundance at the beginning- enough to get you hooked and I'm sure designed to get you to want to spend money to reset the counters/timers later on.

Deck-building is relatively simplistic; add cards from your inventory to the deck you want to use.  Use another currencyt to upgrade your cards- add a point to health, attack, or sometimes an ability.  Once cards reach a certain max level, they can be combined with the same card at max levels to form a new card with a higher base.  Recycle cards you don't want to get more of this upgrade currency.  Buy booster packs with coins and premium currencies to increase your deck.  Basic combos can be figured out in the beginning, and then there's an 'unlock more combos' mechanic on another timer (which can be sped up for currency, of course).

While it's a nice distraction in the beginning, and I personally haven't gotten to the point where I have to wrry about waiting for timers, the whole game just reeks of paying for benefits.  Regular currency is only good for one or two out of 20 or so options that are either premium currency or outright real-world pricing.

Would still say to give it a try, just don't go in expecting a long-lasting experience unless you've got money you want to throw at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967631203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1687824548}
review:
I play this game obsessively on my phone, and it's playable in a browser by logging into http://www.kongregate.com/games/Throwdown/animation-throwdown

So, it's fun (if you like the characters, which I do. If not, it'd be like playing Hearthstone with no familiarity with Warcraft), and it's not really "pay2win", but you're in for a LOT of grinding to keep up with the people throwing hundreds of dollars into a "trading card" game that has no cards and they can't be traded.

But it's a mobile game at its core; it even has forced lag on a lot of the dialog boxes (especially the card-upgrade one) to prevent mis-taps, but on a PC it's a huge annoyance to click a button 4 or 5 times before it responds (it responds on the first click if you [b]WAIT[/b] 3 seconds before clicking, but that's absurd on a PC).  This plagues the web AND Steam versions.

But the Steam version gets a big thumbs down even compared to the web version. It gives you the loot multiplier without watching ads, but it never drops ad crates that have stamina-recharge tools and 500-2000 extra coins in them.  If you play the web version to get the ad crates, you can't even open those crates in the Steam version.

Also, when the Steam version went from ver.141 to ver.142, it insisted on running fullscreen unless you forced it to start in compatibility mode... oh wait, now it's back to ver.141, maybe they reverted that atrocity?

author: {'steamid': '76561197971861422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1494552617}
review:
The game was fun for about 10 hours, rewards just keep pouring in and you can upgrade cards, fight continuous as your energy bars gets refilled fairly quickly.

But after that time, the paywall started to hit. Rewards stopped coming, you always lack energy to fight, it takes 10 minutes for 1 Adventure energy bar to refill and I need 3 to fight (I might also loose cause of OP enemy cards and waste those 30 minutes). Arena bar needs 1 hour for 1 bar and you can only do 4 streak until the OP oponent comes in with their blue and purple cards just destroying you.

Heroes also drops often in the beginning, but at later levels you'll be lucky to even see one appear. Upgrades for your cards also halts as you can't get anymore until you finish specific hard/luck quests or just buy them. (Hope you can buy upgrade amplifiers with in game earned currency)

The game is engineered to be addictive in the first 10 hours or so, then it will hit that usual F2P paywall wherin you have to really buy those energy upgrades and VIP passes.

I have watched films like this, wherein a Drug pusher gives free dope to an individual, then that certain individual gets addicted and relies on that drug, then that;s where the pusher hits the individual with this ridiculous prices and favors for the drug. Good thing this is only a game and if you have self control, you can avoid being sucked in. Pity those who don't have self control though.

If you have self control, then I can recommend this and have an awesome time for like 10 or so hours. You can still keep playing casually for free everyday for 30 minutes (1 hour if you buy energy upgrades) for years to come.

But if you have an addictive personality with no self control, then I would advise you to stay away as this game will make you spend a lot of money just to get by.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017997926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1589812039}
review:
I was pulled in by bobs burgers, I love that show and I got 2 hours of free fun out of this. 
However this is a micro transaction nightmare.
You can only get special cards through very costly micro transactions in the game.
You cant earn these and after you played X games you also need to pay to play or wait a day to continue.
This game requires no skill thanks to a autoplay feature, it plays for you and you can speed up or skip the animation, which essentially turns this game into a clicker game.

If your looking for a meaningful character card game to play this is far from it.
Look at hearthstone or Gwent for powerful free alternatives, (NOT ON STEAM) as steam is going down hill of late with these cash grab milking games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997974710', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1497823773}
review:
you will find yourself wihtout anything to do quite fast in this game. when everything is on cooldown, you can not play this game without paying insane ammounts of money to shorten the cooldowns to make the game playable again. 
it seems like the game is almost designed to be played as little as possible. to be able to play arena you need arena energy, this recharge at a rate of 1 per 1 hour 30(?), but the more games you are able to play (and win in a row) the better the rewards becomes. this means that i should play arena every 10 hour or so.. I will not pay 5$ to recharge my arena timer, thats just insanity.

 the feels buggy in its current state, and it feels extremely much like a phone game, not a pc game. 

the need to find a new business model that does not involve energy bars if they want to succeed as a pc game

author: {'steamid': '76561198037821546', 'num_games_owned': 1397, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1498852730}
review:
Год назад, когда Animation Throwdown только вышел на мобильных устройствах, играл в неё достаточно долго. Да, тут нет той глубины, как в Heartstone, но это в первую очередь фановая и затягивающая карточная игра, которая позволяет  провести часик в день, не напрягая особо мозги.

Плюсы:
+ Большое разнообразие карт из 5-ти вселенных. Разработчики постоянно добавляют все новые и новые карты - и это здорово.
+ Много разнообразных играбельных персонажей со своими фишками.
+ Множество комбинаций карт, что предоставляет достаточно большую вариативность геймплею.
+ Юмор
+ Легкость в освоении
+ Донат, который не сильно влияет на геймплей. Побеждать можно не заплатив ни цента, нужно только потратить определенное количество времени на исследования и фарм заданий.
+ Множество игровых режимов
+ Возможность играть одновременно на мобильном устройстве и на пк с синхронизацией игрового процесса

Минусы:
- В пк версии убрали возможность увеличения бонуса за просмотр рекламы, добавив платный бустер
- Очень долгие исследования и восполнение энергии
- Отсутствие реального ПВП - лишь его имитация

По итогу имеем веселую карточную игру, которая не напрягает мозги, а дарит море фана и веселья. Попробовать стоит, даже если не любите жанр.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201880358', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 12675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10532, 'last_played': 1560551620}
review:
Han mejorado mucho desde que salio el juego en Kongregate pero aun no resuelven el tema de que hacer cuando se te acaba la energia. La espera es ridícula de lo prolongada que se vuelve al avanzar el juego. Si es un juego con sistema de energia, una lastima. Buen juego de todas formas: 5/10 estrellas.

Acutalizado: he dejado de jugarlo hace tiempo, no es un juego para divertirse o desafirse, sino uno de colección bastante estresante e ingrato. Si tienes dinero de sobra y tu perro come caviar y puedes pagar a alguien para que se ocupe 24 hs al día de ese amigo entonces este es tu juego. Es un juego disparatado (aclaro por si no fui suficientemente claro)!.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018775649', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1495175382}
review:
Не понятно нафига бесплатной карточной игре Core i5 или Core i7. У меня конечно Core i7 6 ядерный, но это же простейшая игра. Ну когда все игры надоели, то можно поизвращаться и поиграть в эту немного =).
Ну конечно так называемые "пвп-бои" на арене - нифига не пвп. Просто компьютер играет картами подобранного вам соперника.
Периодически встречаются ошибки в интерфейсе.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049103258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1494463603}
review:
This is a non game. 

There is so litle agency involved in what you can do in a turn,  this is a CCG made by someone that never understood CCG's but saw someone play one once.

I feel like a conversation between a dev and his boss went like this: 

"ok, so I think there's two values on all the cards, one is the fight and the other is.. I duno health? and some cards have special abilities, but those would be hard to program, so just use a set of simple ones that a bunch of cards can have" 

"Ok how do you want to show attack? like a fist or a sword or a boxing glove?"
"a hammer"
"but how does that-"
"Make it a hammer, Bill"

The design choices to explain abilities is... odd, below are some conversations that I'm sure took place between some poor designer and his overbearing boss: 


"ok, how about this ability that damages a random enemy, should we show a die to demonstrait the randomness? or a dart?  Or maybe a rocket to show it can hit something that's not in front of it? Or maybe a-"
"Boxing glove"
"but how is that-"
"Make it a boxing glove"
"Isn;t that confusing when we have a more abstract gliph to represent attack ?"
"The hammer is perfect Bill, we've already had that conversatation, make it a boxing glove"
"Oh, ok what about the health drain? Maybe a vampire or a leach or fangs?"
"How about those brain sluggy things form the futureshow?"
"The brain slugs from futuramma? umm they don't really drain-"
"But they stick to ya like leaches! make it that!"



The game is super geared towards microtransactions, which honnestly I was expecting, but it doesn't get its hooks in you so there's never any motivation to spend real money.  A well designed fremium game dangles that *one* thing you *just* need to beat this enemy, if only you could have it now you woudn't have to wait... maybe just spending 5 bucks this one time wouldn't be so bad.  

But this game has none of that, this is mostly because you don't see a wide variety of cards or have any idea which cards can drop from what. Not to mention that a core mechanic in the game is leveling up your cards. BUT packs contain once level one card each  so there's no reason to even entertain the idea that "Buying a pack will improve my chances"  Because from experience you will get a level 1 card that you will never use. 

 You just hit a wall and rather than thinking "ok, if I had this one card I'd be fine" it feels like "oh, I guess I'd have to buy like 50 packs and hope I get *something*  and then level up maybe two or three cards I get and then maybe I'll win?" 

Had someone spent actual money on marketing research to understand consumer behaviours, the developer would have a much more profitable product as it stands only a real idiot will ever spend money on this. 


But the biggest problem is overall This game feels rushed, and the amount of advertising being put into it makes me feel like a lot of money went into it and I kinda hope that that's money that isn't going to be made back. I can't respect this as a game, I can't even respect it from a business perspective since it's so poorly designed from a profitability angle. 



The art on the cards looks like someone screenshot a 240p rip on youtube of the episodes,  and not even the best shot of a given moment / character. It's as if they took an unpaid intern and said "here's a list of all the images we need,  get them before tomorrow"  and all he had was a computer, a crappy internet connection and a few cups of coffee. And when he handed in his sloppy rushed unfinished mess they said "PERFECT, IT'S GOOD TO SHIP!"

author: {'steamid': '76561198015183752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1625808038}
review:
Con:
Can be hard to move the cards into the deck/recycle via mouse. (Don't have that trouble on the app version though.)
People who spend money DO have a distinct advantage in the game.
Can easily spend about 10 minutes and have nothing else to do.


Pro:
Competitive nature of the game is not direct.
You can gain gems even without paying at a decient rate.
You can 'practice' in the arena when you run out of arena points. (Don't get anything for it however.)


I played this on the app before it migrated to Steam. Played from day 1 and will honestly say I enjoy the game as a casual.  The computer version, unfortunatly does not seem to have the ad-options that you find on the app. (Watch an Ad to up your % on coins, cards etc, and opening up dropped locked chests.) This will give people who use the app another advantage on top of the microtransactions. I am hoping I am wrong and just missed how to do it.

The microtransactions are not 'necessary' to progress. Just make it much easier if you can guarentee higher rarity cards. There is a lot of RNG (random number generator) involved, even with the microtransactions. So be aware of that as well. (Some people hate RNG, others don't mind it.)

Anything else...
Nope, cannot think of anything. I do recommend the game. It has it's issues but most games have them. No game comes out flawless, and ports can be tricky to nail down.

Oh, the App and the computer version do share servers.

Sileka, of 'The Silence'

author: {'steamid': '76561197982549003', 'num_games_owned': 1207, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1508656985}
review:
Updated as of 05-22-17 

 So for the longest time I had avoided card type games on steam simply due to the fact that I had never played any card games at all. But since this involved two of my favorite shows Family Guy & American Dad, I had to give it a shot. My first review was very short and not very informative (reason listed in previous post). Quickly had a reply form the developer that said they would fix it. And they have, and, added a launcher with a few options that I did not have available before. So far I am not only enjoying the game, but it is very first time player friendly for people like myself that is new to this genre.

Previous Review:

I would not play this game for a while yet. So those of you that may remember the Starcraft 2's "Computer Melting bug". Running this game for 5 minutes will give you flashbacks...weary about going further into this game due to the fact that after less than 1 minute of it running at 1000+ FPS, my GPU and CPU fans kick on at full speed. Pity, I am a big fan of anything Family Guy & American Dad so I was really hoping to take this game on a test run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268388785', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1495523178}
review: Игра замечательна даже не так она прекрасна. Я всегда мечтал игру где соберутся все персонажи с канала 2x2 и вот пожалуста есть почти все кроме: симпсонов. И да задумка игры интересная карточки пречём такая простая но приятная механика ,а мультфильная графика просто  шик ,но надо сказать о + и - и так. Плюсы:Почти все вселеные,большое разнообразия приятная для глаза графика,игра бесплатная,есть русский язык и т.д. просто о плюсах тут можно говорить бесконечно.Минусы: ну ,а тут сложно просто мне сложно их найти только если 1минус это всегда суют в лицо рекламу наборо чтобы ты их купил. И да многие говорят что без доната тут не как,можно вам задать вопрос? Вы неумеете играть или вы поиграли 3минуты и вышли увидев обилил рекламы? Игру рекомендую буду надеется что скоро добавят симпсонов до скорой встречи шапок вам :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197979521890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 69632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1711787830}
review:
The game is pretty fun. But this game commited one of the biggest sins in gaming, even for an IOS game.
TIMED PLAY WALL!!! WTF were you smoking??  

I can understand micro transactions in a game like this but a Timed Play Wall is unforgivable.
I play Gems of War and even buy their micro transactions but ONLY because they don't have play wall on a timer on how many times i can take a turn.  I will still play this game once every 10min lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198035691061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1498282068}
review:
Was playing on Leapdroid but it became unplayable at level 7 - probably Leapdroid problem. Restarted on Steam and it's fun but cannot figure out how to change my name from Player to something a little less vague. Nothing in discussions about it. Cant merge with Kongregate or it will wipe my original account (with guild leader) as I merged it from the Leapdroid. Overall, it is quite fun, but be prepared for loading crashes and repetitive game play. There are lots of different challenges but as a card game, really only 1 way to play.

Edit : Their customer service is good as they have already responded to my naming issue. Additionally, since this post was made I was able to fix the loading issue by doing a "verify integrity of game files" and rechecking other settings. One of the settings had been set to 32-bit so changed that to 64-bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141754208', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1494353137}
review:
Шедевральные мультсериалы, мультсериалы  нашего с вами детсвтва, что же из себя представляет сие творение(про игру)? 
Все очень просто это 80% доната и 20% игры. Хотелось бы подметить, что это просто слайдшоу из изображений, нет никакой анимации, просто изображения персонажей из мультсериалов и все - это и есть Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards. Играбельность ужасная, 3 часа максимум, дальше уже неинтересно. ВАЖНОЕ ПРИМЕЧАНИЕ! Будь у вас максимальный уровень steam account вы все равно не получите ни одной коллекционной карточки из этой игры, так как вы не совершали внутреигровых покупок свыше 9$. На дворе 2018 год, нам донат не нужен. Игра-пустышка, обертка есть, конфетки нет! Спасибо за внимание! Удачи.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185141615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1527183292}
review:
[h1]На Майских праздниках я решил окунуться в бочку с govnom, как гласит Русская пословица : "в бочке меда ложка дегтя", так вот - это ложка с ponosom.[/h1]
Ура! Что-то новое...хотя, эта игра родной братец "Hearthstone", точь-в-точь такая же помойка.(Почему помойка? Потому что без доната новому игроку далеко не пролезть, не достичь каких-то высот. В случае "hearthston'a" - легенда в ладдере, а тут, та тут практически так же)
[u]Приступим к плюсам :[/u]
[b]1[/b] Карты выполнены в стиле мемасов из интернета или же просто скринов из самих мультов. Пример мема : Гленн Куагмайр(из мультсериала "Гриффины")  с "надроченной" левой рукой, побитая Мэгг("Гриффины"), Крис("Гриффины") в костюме [spoiler]gandona[/spoiler] и т.д. и т.п.
[b]2[/b] Небольшая история по самим мультсериалам.
Всё, конец.(но это не точно(нет]
[u]Минусы:[/u]
[b]1[/b] Вид карт, а именно сама картинка внутри рамки, в качестве 360/480p, иногда 720p.(Bled, я подумал что мое зрение за 4 дня выходных упало до -5, но присмотревшись... стер пот с лба).
[b]2[/b] Щас вы упадете [spoiler]nahui[/spoiler]. Чтобы играть больше 6 игр за раз - нужно ждать. БLEАТЬ , в игре 2017 года есть КД на битвы, это не только "ХертСтоун" так и "WOW", ору как Dаун.
[b]3[/b] Бесконечный донат на все. Хотите сделать новое комбо из карт, но не хотите ждать - платите. Хотите поиграть больше 6 раз, но не хотите ждать - платите. Хочешь ещё больше крутых картишек в колоду - плати(В этом и есть сходство этой пapaши c "XEРСТОНЕТ").Но если вы очень терпеливый, примерно как Хатико, можете заходить в игру раз в 1-2 часа.
[b]4[/b]Тупые надписи во время загрузки. В первый раз при запуске полоска загрузки стала колом на 24%, так вот эти eбanie реплики довели меня до пены изо рта, они менялись каждые 0,7 секунд, одна за другой, одна за другой, даже 3 раза подряд всплывали одинаковые( кстать, такое чувство, что эти словосочетания полностью скопированы из выше упомянутой игры, но разработчики не тупые, заменили по 1 словечку).
[u]Минусов много, но мне лень выписывать, хотите покупаться в govne, читая тупые шутечки 2007г - смело заходите.[/u]
3 Крисов В ПРЕЗИКЕ из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060486634', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4412, 'last_played': 1641940927}
review:
PayToWin und zwar massiv! An jeder nur erdenklichen Ecke muss man warten oder kommt nicht weiter und kann das dann natürlich mit Hilfe der sehr teuren Ingame-Währung umgehen. Klassisches Konzept. Scheint zu funktionieren. Bis zu einem gewissen Grad kann ich das verstehen. Schließlich ist das Spiel erstmal kostenlos (erstmal groß und fett gedruckt). Aber wenn mir dann irgendwelche Pakete für 100 Dollar angeboten werden und darin erschreckend wenig enthalten ist, dann hört auch mein Verständnis auf. 

Fazit: Super Spiel. Klasse Aufmachung, Story usw. Nur entweder sollte man reich sein oder Nerven aus Stahl und viiiiiiiiieeeeel Zeit haben.

review: So a while ago i posted a negative review on this game due to it having a lot of pay to win and the game wasn't even loading in at times. The developers responded to my review and we worked on solving the issue, but for some reason I just didn't get back to playing it until a couple days ago when I decided to give this one another shot. And boy am I glad I made that decision. It's one of the best card games out there right now. Period. It may be repetitive, but that's about every card game out there. I love this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970184708', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1494298306}
review:
The game is plagued by RNG and P2W. They teach you to fuse 2 cards together to make powerful combos, then sell that very same combo as a single card (Precombo). The P2W players buy the precombos and don't have to take an extra turn to create the combo from 2 cards so they ALWAYS have a turn advantage. 

The game could be really fun if they toned down the P2W and went back to deck building.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065483048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 872, 'last_played': 1496332221}
review:
horrible mobile game port.   This is Steam!  Game should have a price point of $5-10 with easier ways to unlock things.  Sound in the game needs a lot of work. I don't expect tons of audio from the characters- but some would be nice!  

It's fun for a few minutes and could be a great card game IF sound was fixed, it wasn't just a "in-app purchase" garbage game.  Waiting for turns is something PC gamers don't want to do and shouldn't have to do.   Also- a pack of cards shouldn't have ONE CARD!  So stupid. The word pack means more than one!

(Edit #1)- I have played the game more but it feels like a time killer and not much else.  I wont spend any real money on this until it becomes less pay2win.  

(Edit #2)- Still haven't noticed any major update on the game. Also want to point out- there is a card limit- so once you hit the total cards, you can't open any more packs unless you fuse or recycle.  Pretty stupid.

I will edit this review if the game makers address any of the issues I've mentioned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045655704', 'num_games_owned': 3553, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 2241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1500580704}
review:
Oui...c'est un Pay-To-Win...mais cela ne nous empêche pas de nous y amuser. Comprenez-le plutôt comme le fait que payer peut nous procurer de sacrés avantages matériels et de temps, mais que si vous jouez pour le fun, ce n'est heureusement pas indispensable.

Pour commencer, je pense que pour apprécier [i]Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards[/i], il faut tout d'abord apprécier l'une ou plusieurs des séries qui font l'intérêt du jeu, à savoir Family Guy (les Griffin), American Dad, Futurama, Bob's Burgers et King of the Hill. Sinon, le jeu n'a que très peu d'intérêt...

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=922381856

Le jeu en lui-même est très basique, c'est un jeu de cartes dans lequel il va falloir faire des "combos" (fusions) pour améliorer celles-ci en jeu et battre celles de l'adversaire et ses points de vie. Le tutoriel, bien qu'un peu long, nous explique assez bien les mécaniques du jeu, même si on en apprendra plus dans la pratique. On choisit un héro tiré des séries et on construit au fur et à mesure notre jeu avec les cartes qu'on gagne/débloque ou achète via les packs et qu'on améliore.

L'un des gros points positifs, c'est qu'il y a beaucoup de choses à faire dans ce jeu (bien que cela ne concerne presque que jouer aux cartes). Il y a un mode aventure/chapitre, un mode arène/PvP, un mode guilde/PvP, un mode défi, des recherches à effectuer pour débloquer les combos, des améliorations de cartes à acheter, la possibilité de recycler les cartes qu'on ne veut pas, des "quêtes" (objectifs) à faire, etc...
Les modes fonctionnent avec un système de jeton : un combat = 1 ou plusieurs jetons utilisés. On les récupère avec le temps qui passe, c'est plus ou moins long selon les modes (assez rapide pour le mode aventure, une heure par jeton pour le mode arène). Notre réserve de jetons s'agrandit avec notre niveau PvE (si je ne dis pas de bêtises), et si on monte de niveau alors que notre réserve est pleine, la recharge se fait quand même et on se retrouve avec genre 20 jetons dans la réserve qui ne peut en contenir que 9. C'est une bonne chose. Et comme au début on monte "vite" de niveau, on croule rapidement sous les choses à faire, ce qui donne plusieurs heures à jouer avant de véritablement avoir à attendre.

Concernant le PvP, je n'ai pas l'impression d'avoir véritablement affronté qui que ce soit...j'ai plutôt l'impression qu'on affronte des "images" d'autres joueurs, c'est-à-dire des IA qui jouent avec le jeu des joueurs. Déjà parce que je commence [u]toujours[/u] chaque combat, ce qui me donne un avantage certain...que personne n'a jamais rage-quitté ou capitulé alors que c'était évidemment perdu pour eux...que les "joueurs" ne profitent pas ou très peu des avantages liés aux évènements en cours...et surtout parce que la réponse de jeu de l'adversaire est toujours immédiate, il ne donne pas l'impression de prendre du temps pour réfléchir quand c'est à lui de jouer. Bref, tout ça pour dire que, à mon avis, le PvP n'en est pas réellement, et donc dire à ceux qui ne sont pas trop PvP (comme moi) qu'il s'agit en fait d'affronter des jeux humains dirigés par des IA.

Maintenant oui, il faut bien le redire, c'est un Pay-To-Win. Les recherches de combos pour les meilleures cartes (rares, épiques, etc..) sont longues, on nous propose souvent d'acheter des lots "alléchants" via les monnaies virtuelles qu'il faut  en général acheter avec de l'argent bien réel, c'est le gros point négatif du jeu.
À côté de cela, il y a des choses un peu déroutantes, comme le fait que pour monter les niveaux des héros, il faut gagner l'expérience par chance (parce que ça ne tombe pas souvent) dans les combats d'arène. Jouer avec un héro ne l'améliore pas. En y réfléchissant, vu les bonus que les niveaux donnent, ce n'est peut-être pas plus mal d'avoir rendu la chose aléatoire, sinon ça devient vite "cheaté"...
Il y a aussi beaucoup de monnaies différentes dans le jeu...on est un peu perdu du coup. Je ne sais d'ailleurs toujours pas à quoi peut bien servir les crottes dorées...

En conclusion, si vous aimez une ou plusieurs des séries du jeu, que vous aimez les jeux de cartes, et que vous n'êtes pas pressés d'avoir tout de suite un jeu de fou, [i]Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards[/i] pourrait bien vous plaire. La plupart des évaluations négatives résultent du fait que c'est un Pay-To-Win...oui, c'en est un, mais il suffit de le dire et de bien le souligner. Je n'ai pas mis le moindre centime dans ce jeu, et je ne compte pas en mettre, mais je me suis bien amusé jusque là. Pour le moment donc, je recommande le jeu.
Si le système devient abusif du fait de monter en niveau, c'est-à-dire agréable au début pour plaire puis désagréable par la suite à cause des temps d'attente qui poussent à acheter, j'en ferai part ici.

[code]Vous avez aimé cette évaluation ? Retrouvez-en d'autres en rejoignant notre groupe de rédaction : [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/onlespreferefroids#curation]On les préfère froids.[/url][/code]
