author: {'steamid': '76561198030957376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2544, 'last_played': 1544013647}
review:
Don't listen to the negative reviews and try it out for yourself, after all it is free.

I have put quite a few hours into this game since releasing on Steam and I am enjoying it, although I am only halfway through the campaign. There is quite a high cost if you want to pay to play but it is easily playable without spending any money, I have only paid for VIP but without people spending money the game would shut down.

Pros

- Enjoyable enough to sink some time into
- Five different types of modes, each with their own energy system.
- Definately don't have to pay to play, you will sometimes bump into someone with really strong cards but not often
- Matches are quick, maybe a minute each
- As of writing there are thirty levels of campaign each with there own star system to earn the cards.
- Earn lots of money in game, not premium currency, to buy card packs. Hint, save up and buy max cards as I got a few epics this way.

Cons

- You don't get a lot of energy, even with VIP, so you may have to return a few times per day to maximise your levelling, you can add a larger maximum cap for real money.
- Timers are ridiculous, over an hour to get one piece of energy for the arena and researching the later combos can take 48 hours, so I have heard, not got there myself yet with my longest research taking 24 hours. You can pay real money for the machine that speeds up research.
- No real PVP. You are literally playing against a bot that chooses the cards in the players deck. Real PVP needs adding, if you are looking for a Hearthstone or Elder Scrolls Legends clone this is not it.
- It is a chore to sell all common cards, you have to remove them manually from each deck which has no option, that I can see, to remove all the cards from a deck.

Please do not listen to the reviews, try it and see if you like it yourself. I almost never downloaded it after reading the reviews first but I am happy I did. I really hope they keep adding to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070562936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1643160879}
review:
Meh!...

I played the game for several hours and it is mostly how this game is.

At first, the premise of a game using characters of some animated series like Bob's burger, Futurama, Family Guy and same American Dad, looks quite interesting but more you play and more this interest go away.

Matches are really shorts (can be around 30 secs at max...) and you mostly only can play for 10 minutes at the time. The game system works around ''action'' points and every match of any kind uses those points.  And when the ''max out'' action point you can have are around 10, that matches can consume 1 to 3 action points and that the fastest points regenerate is 1 each 10 minutes, you will have to wait many, many, many times...

Nothing really tie together. Cards are only crop freeze frames of the series, you don't any real motivation behind what you have to do, everything is mostly just randomize. 

It is fun a short time but after that short time, the hype fade quite fast too. If you want to try, go for but don't waste money on it, it's not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015162915', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5236, 'last_played': 1599712390}
review:
Playing since the game came out on September 2016. Theres no doubt that this game has the most ridiculous prices you ever saw in a f2p game!

Not only that, the game favors p2w and people who spent money have a huge advantage over others.

You dont have the possibility to get certain cards which only are obtainable if you spent money, BIG MONEY!

There are top10 guilds where people spent thousands of dollars just to be on top! These people literally pay the devs salaries and keep the game alive..cos hey,..who's supid enough to pay 400 bucks for one card!?

If you think these things will change, lower prices, no enormous gap between f2p and p2w i can assure you, those greedy devs wont change a thing. They showed us over the past months how greedy they are and they dont really listen to the community.

Edit:
[strike]They said a few weeks ago they going to make the rewards fairer and dont nerf them like they did with the latest update a few days ago. Prev. you could get legendary stones from challenges and brawls in the arena. Now the only chance you could get those are Rumbles which are every 3 weeks.
Meanwhile, the same players who are always on top of those brawls and challenges are getting their mythic stones - where you also had the chance to earlier before the update in lower ranks to get 10 stones. Now gone, too.
There are tons of threads and a petition regarding this issue and people start to boykott their move![/strike]

Edit: They giving back the leg stones to challenges and brawls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054665576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1613412498}
review: As someone who has played this game since it originally came out on mobile, I can say with confidence and the utmost sincerity, avoid this game at all costs. Back in the first few months of the game, the divide between f2p and p2w was managable. There weren't game breaking cards back then, so the majority of decks were made of 90% farmable cards. Then the box (paid) cards got better. Wildly overpowered pre-combo cards that, if pulled on the first turn, is akin to getting Exodia. It means your opponent automatically loses. If you started back in the begining of the game, you had the ability to farm story levels. As of about 2 weeks ago (at least on the mobile side, idk if this version has it too) you can no longer farm. This makes the divide between the 2 sides infinitely more expansive. There are, however, a few things that I can positively say about the game. While almost 95% of the best cards used to be locked behind a paywall, now, through the use of challenge coins, you can actually get some valuable box cards, which is an improvement. This game, unfortuantely, works on the idea of '1 step forward, 3 steps back'. If they give us challenge coins to give f2p characters box cards, then they have to take away farming, make new players disadvantaged by making their research times be 4 times what a paying players are, and make even more insanely OP cards that only the fattest of whales could ever hope to obtain. I understand that when managing 5 big IPs like the shows in this game, they need to make a pretty penny just to justify the games exsistence, but this is ridiculous. Take it from someone who has spent over $200 in this game in its prime, if you know what's good for you, avoid this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213159765', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1494974412}
review:
Te gustan los combates por turnos?, te gustan los juegos de cartas?, te gustan las animaciones de FX?...!! PUES ESTE JUEGO ES PARA TI !!.
Después de jugarlo por casi dos horas "Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards" cumplió lo que prometía, un juego de cartas simple pero entretenido.
Con un humor que ñaaa daba para mas, parece un estereotipo de cada personaje con frases que 
no van muy acordes con la personalidad de cada uno pero que INTENTA adaptarse a ello.
Sus combates que al inicio te parecen muy aburridos, luego se hacen algo mas interesantes. aun así sigue siendo muy repetitivo, PERO ES UN JUEGO DE CARTAS POR DIOS xD
Lo recomiendo porque ES GRATIS, IT'S FREEE!!!. oye y tambien esta en español eso ayuda para los que tienen conocimiento basico de ingles (Como yo).
tiene algunos pros y contras

PROS 
-Su dificultad es nivelada, va subiendo a corde vas mejorando. pero hay algunas veces donde te pone un reto mas dificil ahi tienes que aumentar mas la calidad de tus cartas y eso me gusta porque lo hace mas competitivo. 
-Tiene bastantes referencias a las series originales y si eres fan (como yo x2) te parecerá el doble de divertidas. 
-ES GRATIS 
-Gran variedad de cartas/ataques/ mejoras.

Contras 
-Batallas muy repetitivas 
-Como dije antes los personajes que no son acordes a como ellos son. frases muy forzadas y aun que no lo crean eso daña mucho la experiencia del juego. 
-Historia muy simplona, daba para mucho mas teniendo tantos personajes y muchas personalidades diferentes

Desde mi punto de vista el juego esta bien, solo que por ser fan de las series me molesta que los personajes no actúan acorde a cómo son ellos.
Mi puntuación para el juego? 7/10.
Como siempre digo, disculpen si mi redacción esta mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316802573', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1496612523}
review: esse e o melhor jogo de cartas que ja joquei RECOMENDO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990527888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1501658446}
review:
I understand the FTP vs paid game concept but to also have a resource that limits how many times you can play has got to go.  Theoretically I could spend $1000 and still only play for 30 mins.  Not my kind of investment.  I'll spend $80 and get 16200 mins of progressive content not to mention replayability.

EDIT:  I have played some more.  The arena matches are well done.  Not too OP that your facing uber opponents, but also you don't skyrocket from bottom to top.

  I'm slowly getting very addicted to this game.  Key seems to be learning combo's and researching them and upgrading cards accordingly.  You may get a ATV card but not all character cards can use it, hence research.  

The typical leveling up cards is a must once you find good combinations of characters and upgrades for them is done well.  This is the key to enticing money spending.  Upgrade card 3x, combine with another upgraded card of same, hence buy a booster/gems/spend money. you don't have to, but it's faster.

All in all I have to change my no to a yes as I have a spent more time enjoying it now than not.

I still must site the dev's that if you want me to spend money, remove the energy cap/requirement for solo play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047461532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1502042135}
review:
Bon petit jeu de cartes sans trop de prétention.
Très agréable à jouer un petit peu chaque jour, comme faire quelques run d'un die and retry tous les jours.
Cela fait déjà plusieurs mois que je joue et je ne m'en lasse toujours pas, oui mon compteur affiche peu, mais je viens juste de lier mon compte à steam.
A mon sens le jeu est clairement free to play, quoi que certain en pense, avec leur dernière mise à jour on accumule enormément de cartes sans payer un centime.
La recherche des combos est un peu longue pour les cartes les plus rares mais si comme moi vous ne comptez pas passer toute votre journée dessus cela vous paraitra très acceptable. 
Je suis déjà bien évolué et pas encore un centime de déboursé et je ne pense pas en dépenser plus.

Bref si vous ne voulez pas vous prendre la tête je vous le recommande ce deck builder fun et en permanente évolution.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974455673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1494272086}
review:
Put a good few hours into this game now, it comes fast apparent that this game is just a cash cow, everything is over-priced and you can see at almost every turn the game is trying to push you into spending money, everything in the game is a time sink with the option to pay for speed ups, I mean I was enjoying it, I just can't justify playing a game that is all about trying to get your cash out of you to experience game play.

If you want a good free to play card game try Faeria, progression can be earned and it's not like some mobile game where it tries to charge you for the simplest of actions, of course if you put money into the game you can get some cooler things or unlock a deck faster, but it doesn't force your hand, the game is there for you to enjoy and it gives you ample cards to try different things and even has a mode where you open a bunch of booster packs to make a hot seat deck, so lots of PVP fair fun to be had too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121726515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1576672692}
review:
Alright for the first few hours, after that you are spammed with pop-ups about micro-transactions which you need to progress through the game at a good rate. E.g. to research card combos it can take 24 hours PER card, or you can simply pay real money for it to research instantly

All in all if you are happy with paying for micro-transactions I would say to give it a go (however be warned that it is very expensive e.g. $30 for ONE SINGLE legendary card). Otherwise don't waste your time and get hooked into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245334540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1494437309}
review:
I played probably about an hour and a bit of this today. I'm not even remotely a pro gamer (or even a good gamer, I play for fun, not to specifically win), but out of an hour's worth of games I was basically wiping the floor with my opponent in every single match (making me feel the game is horribly unbalanced).

I only lost one match out of probably about 50. Fun game, but you don't really control your cards you just kinda lay them out and the game does the rest.

That being said, it is fun to pass a little bit of time when you're bored. Plus it's free!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029511756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 31873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1534309389}
review:
Look -- yes, its true - those who pay more, win more -- and that effing sucks. They really do need to balance out that whole pay-wall thing.... HOWEVER....If you get in a great guild and you play your daily challenges  - you will amp up in power quite quickly.

I have been playing this game since it first came out - and with dedication and time, I've gotten a pretty solid deck (is it as good as the jerks who pour in too much money? - Hell no) -- but it is still fun all the same.

I love the inside jokes from the show, the friendships you can make in your guilds, and Rumble is always a rush! I think they really are working on the game and trying to make it more balanced and fair. The dev team takes a lot of our feedback very seriously and have implemented changes.

Don't like it now? Just hang around - you'll be a power house in no time -- and please, please, please just reach out to the Dev team on their Kongregate page - they do read your requests. If you do it respectfully and with a good argument, they typically reply well and then implement said changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064973195', 'num_games_owned': 1107, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1494254098}
review:
Mobile Port Cash in checklist:
-Shallow, repetitive gameplay that casual gamers would get addicted to
-Exorbitant amounts of money being charged for premium currency
-Again, premium currency
-Card packs that can be bought with said currency
-Different tier rankings of cards, introducing a P2W system as you are more likely to get epics if you pay more, and cards get more powerful as the tiers rise
-Speech bubble still mentioning mobile devices at the start
-Popular IP to bring in da moolah from recognition
Yup, ticks all the boxes.

Please don't pump money into this game, it doesn't deserve it. Also I5 OR I7 RECOMMENDED?? HAHAHAHAH

author: {'steamid': '76561198067109130', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 5975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1703288782}
review:
Advertencia! Si quieres jugar F2P este juego. Debes tener paciencia, muchisima.

---------RESUMEN------
Si tienes dinero de sobra, te gusta los dibujos de Fox, intenta jugar esto, porque al comienzo te dan un tutorial. Si no te enoja que este medio traducido o que existan bugs raros, pruebalo!
Ya llevo dos sesiones de 4 horas y no se si terminare la aventura, o si complete las cartas. Porque despues de la primera sesion, los turnos se ultra limitaron y se recargan de manera muy lenta. Me aconsejan invertir dinero en cada rincon del juego. Eso hace que el hype desaparezca de a pocos.Porque definitivamente pienso que no es un juego para jugar f2p. A pesar de que es gratuito.
--------FIN -----------

Jugar este juego es como caminar sobre un campo minado. Las minas vendrian a ser el dinero que te piden de multiples maneras (todas psicologicamente estudiadas metiendote nostalgia por los personajes para que le metas dinero).

Mi primera sesion duro 4 horas de free to play !! ! !
Edito para poner que solo la primera sesion fue algo muy divertido, despues a sido solo mera curiosidad. Tanto asi que mi aburrimiento me llevo a comprar el started pack por 5$.

No saben el arrepentimiento que siento . . . .
 
Soy super sincero al decir que descargue este juego para burlarme. Porque pense que era una reverenda porqueria. Lo es! Pero a mediano plazo. Lo describire como la mecanica que usa este juego. Tu paciencia es de 10 cargas. Cada carga es una sesion. Creo que 10 es mucho. Y si! A la larga es un juego que premia al curioso nostalgico por los personajes de su serie, al que tiene dinero de sobra, al inteligente (pero en serio alguien le invertiria tanto tiempo para analizar como hacer todo de manera correcta? gamer PE!)

Un detalle que no se si les pase a todos. Mientras mas agranden la ventana de juego, sera como si le metiran patadas a los huevos a su procesador.  

Tiene un sistema de Leaderboard (gracias!) de 90k personas. No se si en serio ya 90k personas lo han probado, pero si veo mucho usuario con el nombre por default ¨player¨. Sinceramente considero eso como publicidad engañosa. Pero tambien realmente no me interesa porque lo que me tiene amarrado al juego son los premios por ganar (que se reducen drasticamente despues de tu primera sesion lo que hace este juego un casino disfrazado de juego). Como mi paciencia con este juego.

Como aspecto negativo me encontre su tienda donde por 5 dolares te regalan todo el esfuerzo de jugarlo f2p. Me pregunto si los dueños de este juego no pensaran que eso es tomarnos el pelo. En realidad eso me enoja porque deberian disimular las ganas que tienen de sacarle dinero a sus clientes. Deberia tener turnos con un limite mayor. A la larga hasta puedes calcular si te da la gana, en cuanto tiempo te demorara acabar el juego.

Asi como me paso, les aconsejo probarlo. Y si no les gusta venir y escribir el porque y darle su pulgar abajo. Pero, pruebenlo! 

Como detalle final porque no volvere a editar este contenido....... este juego es bueno para pasar el rato. Dejalo rapido e intenta no meterle dinero si no te sobra para que no te sientas como un tonto usado. Suerte!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093560408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1641380838}
review:
Pro:
-Se conoscete almeno un paio delle serie citate tipo Griffin e American Dad è divertente ma se non ne conoscete nessuna non vale la pena
-il gioco è semplice e funziona anche in gran parte solo con l'avventura contro il pc, le modalità contro altri giocatori potrebbero risultare frustranti o troppo facili a seconda di quanto avete pompato il vostro mazzo
-se vi collegate spesso durante la giornata ci sono tutte le fusioni da scoprire e collezionare che sono molto carine

Contro:
-Se c'erano anche i Simpson era meglio.. e una delle 4 serie citate è praticamente sconosciuta in italia
-Di stampo quasi da telefono non ha nessuna impostazione grafica o prestazionale ed è scarsamente ottimizzato le temperature dei core e scheda grafica salgono subito parecchio senza giusta motivazione
-la meccanica è grezza e punta parecchio al pompamento delle carte anche con pagamento seppur in svariate ore di gioco non si può definire del tutto pay to win
-specialmente all'inizio nonostante la semplicità del gioco alcune meccaniche risultano più o meno comprensibili e si finice a buttare giu carte a caso cercando di mettere insieme il valore di attacco e salute più alto possibile

author: {'steamid': '76561198100439359', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1497124485}
review:
Je fais une évaluation minimaliste car vous pouvez tester le jeu vous même et que je vous surtout parler du coté négatif principal. 

Un jeu de cartes PvE qui ne révolutionne mais qui peut être sympa si vous aimez cet univers. C'est la même chose que les milliers de jeux de ce genre avec un système d'énergie, un faux système de multijoueurs etc...

Les deux points noirs du jeu:
-La version steam est moins optimisé que la version web sur Kongregate. Sur Kong ou sur mobile, vous pouvez voir 3 pubs pour pouvoir booster vos gains (indispensable).
-Le jeu est officiellement un F2P. Il peut être un P2W car la quantité de choses que vous pouvez acheter est collosal et c'est clairement affiché. Tous les semaines de nouveaux pack, de nouveaux events (voire même deux a la fois), y en a tellement que ca fait vomir. Cependant, si vous pouvez vous élever au dessus de tout ça pour vraiment profiter du jeu il faudra acheter deux items. Un pour réduire les temps de recherches (20€) et un pour augmenter votre énergie (10€). Avec ces deux items vous pouvez profiter du jeu sans vous sentir frustrer... Par exemple, une recherche qui prendrait 6h avec l'item en prendra 24 sans l'item. Une recherche qui prendrait 15min va prendre 2h...

author: {'steamid': '76561198015468267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 3747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1666, 'last_played': 1512992419}
review:
Don't mind the game.
At the point I'm up to, it's gonna take some time before I can complete the current Adventure Questline and the Arena based questline.
Gaining Hero Tokens is entirely random through doing Arena Battles. The only other way is by doing Challenge Mode Battles which gives you barely any currency that goes towards the 1000 needed in order to open a box that will gives you random Hero Tokens. Since the Quest requires I have a Hero reach level 5, you gotta just hope you get some that goes towards the one character you need to get you through.
Also, the waiting time for Arena Mode is rediculous once you get through the initial amount of tries they give you as you start the game for the 1st time.
Pretty much pace of progress is good in your 1st 4-5 hours. Slows down a lot after that.

In terms of gameplay, it's quite enjoyable.
Animations are good.
Matches are quick.
Comebacks are possible when hope may look lost.
Combo system is cool.

Do not use the auto-play as it can't seem to work out combos, and has 0 logic in it's strategy.

It does need to specify the card levels better after card fusions. You usually need to look at Attack, Health or Abilities in order to work it out. If you're in a rush though, you can make mistakes in picking the wrong card to play.

Server connection is quite garbage like all the other Kong games I've played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960783617', 'num_games_owned': 2437, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 187472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 703, 'playtime_at_review': 2388, 'last_played': 1712456428}
review:
UPDATED on 9-18-2019

-----------------------

I did enjoy this game with my wife for quite a long while and I don't regret spending my time playing it with her.  But as I truly do want to keep this short, it went from a fun game to a mindless "GIMMIE GIMMIE" game where it ask for so much money for the littlest of things.

Which is annoying but fine.  But the moment which made me rage quit and utterly annoyed that I REGRET now spending around $200 for a game that I once enjoyed with my wife, is the utter and almost offensive love for the cartoon "King of the Hill".

For every good combo they give to Family Guy or Bob's Burgers, they give at least two or three to that KotH show and to show my point, Futurama has nothing that really goes well with it but did any of the love go for that show...no, KotH needs yet another unbeatable combo.

First it was "Paddling Peggy", then "Billdozer" and now a simple Legendary combo from KotH that beats the "H" out of any higher demanded but 'in the current fashion where it would get bonuses' card, Cigarette Addict.   Heck, Cigarette Addict doesn't even have to be in the special event and it will still own over those cards that are.

The final straw for me though is when my wife and I were deciding to quit this game but we were so close to a Super Mythic Rare for me so we continued together.  Well, these three cards were what was offered to me and try not to laugh that I already had Bob in a higher level of level 4 too.

----------------------------------------

This game was okay but I have long since left it.  It is tolerable but is sorta no longer an example for "Animation Throwdown" as most of the shows are off the air but the biggest complaint is how they make it a clustertruck to just use your deck again after a fresh install of the game....why are we punished for reinstalling the game off of a system wipe?

https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/780735452941353272/07EA5E3C10A88EB92B0DAE848453D3348A3F2F39/

----------------------
Update with 1500+ hours into it.  

I am still playing it and although it has some pretty big flaws to it, I still find SOME fun with it so I am still 
here.

----------

I'm at 2394 hours now, I mostly play as it is a game that my wife and I just do together.  Sure, I spend $20 a month on the game and I can have a hand filled with Mythic Rares by now so the game is somewhat fun.  I just wish they would stop asking 'for the moon' when it comes for charging gross amount of money for mild things.

A suggested $30 a month for both passes is a bit much for a game that was cheaply made that is over four years old by now.

------------

Further update...not much has changed but I'm still here so it may be worth trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265149465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2916, 'last_played': 1505510628}
review: Играю в эту игру 1 день. Сама тактика игры достаточна проста, за начальные фул энергию и время для изучения комбо вполне реально создать и выиграть сильные карты на первое время. Люди пишут,что через два месяца им не хватает энергии, но мне не хватает ее уже сейчас, а контролировать комп каждые пару часов глупо. Куда бы ни шло,если бы был разумный донат, но он запредельный,да и к тому же нет перманентых покупок. Сама по себе игра увлекательна для своего жанра, но отсутствие доступного времени для игры без массовых финансовых вливаний  портит абсолютно все впечатление.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096158050', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1494734189}
review:
Симулятор казино! 
- Здесь вы будете страдать от нападения злых гопников,которые могут себе позволить пакет семечек.
- Здесь вы почувствуете насколько может быть ценной как*шка.
- Здесь вы получите незабываемую ненависть к гардеробу и костюмам впринципе.
- Здесь вы будете жадно сосать у потных мужиков чтобы те отдали вам свои карточки.
- Здесь вы познаете истинную суть Дзена,потому что вы будете сидеть и ждать пока противник придумает как вас у*бать.
- Здесь вы будете думать что вы - Питер Гриффин,но на самом деле вы - презерватив!
- Здесь вы будете дико кидаться бумагой,чтобы потом отчаянно её отработать.
- Здесь вы узнаете как правильно оскорбить противника,чтобы тот закидал вас бумагой.
- Здесь вы будете ждать пока появиться золотые как*шки,чтобы задонатить на легендарную как*шку.
- Здесь вы познаете всю силу "Интернет-порно"!
- Здесь вы будете измерять размер своего х*я с помощью "отличного" комьюнити.

Бумага - это любовь. Бумага - это жизнь. Но как*шки будут лучше.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037425550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 35987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3975, 'last_played': 1559142670}
review:
Let me review this game as player who started playing like when the game got wide release. (yes, where everyone got free speed research coz of that)

Why the hell do I need buy vip to get ad bonus? Il rather play on mobile to get higher chance unpacking legendary or epic card from basic pack.

ANd not only that, but turd packs has mostl ikely chance you open an epic card that is not pre-combo and you really do not want it.

Why they fricking wont remove cards that I can easily get from adventure?!

Also it takes I dont know how many days to get 800 gems to open a box and get dissapointed.

Also hank hills everywhere while I dont have it. I dont know where people got the card suddenly, but it pisses me off with combo card called devil hank

No thanks. You changed it worse.

EDIT: There was a "bigger" update in game, which added 7-day calendar and month calendar. Month calendar included mythic stones and on last day 1k legendary stones. Players that did not spend any money into this game can legitly get mythic stones for being active.

For this such change, I consider poor players gets little richer. However, whalers/spenders can access to the calendar too, so the gap between both rich and poor people does change a bit only for poor, but in reality both has benefit for this update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017785434', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1494268709}
review:
Für das Schlauphone ist es eines der besten, und zweifelsfrei wohl auch das humorvollste Kartenspiel das es gibt. 
Es macht Spaß bekannte Szenen aus seinen lieblings Cartoons zu entdecken und sammeln zu können.
Die unterschiedlichen Kombinationsmöglichkeiten lassen einen gewissen taktischen Spielraum und das Bezahlsystem ist noch längst nicht so unfair bzw. überteuert wie in vielen anderen f2p Spielen.

Die vorliegende PC-Fassung ist jedoch leider nichts als eine billige Emulation, die auch noch mit der selben miserablen Performance  wie auf dem Handy läuft.
Zusätzlich hat man hier nichtmal mehr die Möglichkeit sich Werbeclips für den Reward Booster angucken zu können.

Das einzige Argument dafür es über Steam zu spielen wäre ein Echtzeit-PvP Modus, ohne diesen ist es momentan insgesamt so nicht empfehlenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200893575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1643828608}
review:
This is them, this is what they sound like: 'Oh I won't spend money on a F2P game even though I'd play it constantly for months' As they drop $60 on a console game that they'll play for a week. F2P is a mental hangup, not a logical one.

This game is great! One of the best parts is that the AI plays the other players decks. No more waiting for slow players or even waiting for players to match with at all - get your fix instantly!  No more stupid pleasantries: 'GG', 'Hello' - MAN I dont care!

The mechanics are great, the strategy is about the level of Hearthstone - certainly simpler than Magic.

And how Fox gathered all this IP into one game is a miracle.  Wish they had gotten Archer too.  Its on FX, Fox owns that... oh well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965468210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1564459031}
review:
100% pay to win.  The strongest cards are not earnable or farmable.  They are locked behind a pay only pay wall.
Add in the requirement of "fusion" and needing 4 duplicates of a single card, this means that a "legenday" that costs 10$, actually costs $40 to max out.  One card, in a deck of 25, costs 40$

Mythic cards? $200 for one.  One card, $200, not to mention it has to be leveled up by purchasing it multiple times.  That would cost around $2000.  One card, 2k.  There's 5 different mythics.

For those who are free to play, non-adventure cards currently take about 2 months to farm 1 new card.  If you are "free to play"  you will earn 1 new card about once every 2 months.  You unlock those new cards with "golden turds"  Makes sense I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087055013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1503536103}
review:
Играю с сентрября. Поначалу было неплохо и интересно, но вот прошло более полугода и игра скатилась в дичайший ДОНАТ. Хотите выигрывать или просто удержаться на арене - готовьтесь отстегнуть денюжку. Неоправданно сложные для фритуплейщиков уровни в вызовах, киты, которые донатят - у вас будет пригорать, гарантирую. 

И глядя на недавнии обновления, которые, вероятно, были введены, чтобы облегчить игру, страшно подумать, как будут играть новички. Каждый месяц вводят новые карты, которые надо как-то контрить. 

До кучи энергия очень долго восстанавливается. Чтобы сыграть ОДИН раз на арене, придется ждать ПОЛТОРА часа. Одна единица энергии на островах (источнике карт) восстанавливается десять минут, однако стоимость одного боя варьируется от трех до возможно восьми-девяти на более сложных островах.

P.S. Если вы все-таки решитесь играть именно в Стиме, спешу вас обрадовать - бесплатно пользоваться небольшими бонусами от просмотра рекламы вы не сможете. Дроп карт, токенов персонажей и, самое главное, количество монет будет меньше в два раза. Как вариант только покупка ВИП-пасса.

review:
After 35 minutes of playing, i'm just sick... How does this even get on Steam, like I know there's a lot of crap on here, but this really cuts the cake on cashing in. I thought steam was a platform with some integrity left, but if this and other "games" get on here, I guess there's not much left you can really say about it.

If you've got any form of respect for yourself and others, do not spend a cent on this pile of shi t, if you support this game you're essentially taking a massive dump on the entire community by allowing crap like this to grow and flourish. 

UPDATE: People have literally added me, telling me to kill myself for having an opinion and "Bad mouthing steam" 10/10 proving my point even more...

author: {'steamid': '76561198080912230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1562259960}
review:
So yes this is a pay to win game and I've played it since day one on my mobile as a time passer at work but you don't NEED to pay, you can still compete with the free cards.
Stop moaning about p2w, it's the same with all these types of games, simply enjoy playing, completing the story and competing in Rumbles, simple.
That being said, it's a total cash grab, if you want to be top 10 in the world in anything these days it'll cost you.
It's random as f"£$k the mechanics make sense and are fun to calculate to win a match but the randomness of it means you can lose simply by looking at your starting cards.
PVP it's not real PVP it may be real players decks but you're playing against a bot which is imo the worst thing about the game not the money the non live PVP action, add that and it's a win.

Lastly, downloaded thinking cool free Steam Achievements after you link your mobile account, well that's not working lol oh well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058277876', 'num_games_owned': 2405, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3, 'last_played': 1494160453}
review:
Es un buen juego de cartas sobretodo para jugar por tu cuenta ya que tiene 30 capitulos de "historia" que se pueden jugar varias veces para conseguir mejores cartas. Tiene modo batalla también, que es como si fuera online pero en realidad solo juegas contra las cartas de ese jugador, no juegas contra él como tal(igualmente está bien). Y luego tienes desafios semanales y batallas de gremios(aunque esto no me va, no se porque).
No es perfecto, hay mucha cosa de pagar, pero no veo que nada sea realmente necesario comprarlo a menos que tengas 0 paciencia. 
Basicamente es un buen juego de cartas gratis para matar el tiempo, si lo que quereis es duelos contra otros jugadores entonces no es vuestro juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136141189', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1501842807}
review:
Сыграв в данный продукт я могу сказать всего чуть-чуть:
1.Игра довольно весёлая(по началу),ведь в ней присутсвуют персонажи из всех нами любимых мультсериалов на TV(кроме симпсонов, там их нету,а очень жаль :с )
2.После 20 минут игры вам станет скучно,ведь игра оооооооочень,оооооооочень лёгкая.
3.Ужасное подобие на HeartStone.
4.При нанесении повреждения ,вашей картой, карты противника у вашей карты не убывают очки HP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036791005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1494151296}
review:
Korábban már játszottam telón és neten is. 
...
A játék maga nem lenne rossz. Grafikailag egész türhető, a játékélmény sem olyan rossz. Viszonylag elfogadható mennyiségű opció és lehetőség áll fent a játékosok számára (tehát nem csak abból áll hogy PvP, hanem lehet egyéb mással is foglalkozni). 
Viszont ami rettenetesen ront az átlagán: [b][i]iszonyatos pénznyelő a játék[/i][/b]. Olyan árakat kérnek el bizonyos contentekért, amiről inkább ne is beszéljünk. Egész gyakran jönnek "akciók" és "eventek", melyek során fokozatosan arra buzdítanak a készítők, hogy a lehető legtöbbet költs a játékra. Eszméletlen árak vannak. Nem ajánlom a játékot, kivéve azoknak akik szívesen elköltenek több száz dollárt hetente a semmire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117511126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1496177726}
review:
TLDR: Yes P2W but aren't all F2P games nowadays? PLAY IT, IT'S FUN!!!

First, this game is a P2W game. Though, it is free and just falls in line with all other F2P games; they have to make money in some way. Now, having said that, I spent the first 5 hours all at once, spent no money and have progressed at a good pace and had no down time. I keep up with the ranked players and the adventure mode. People need to get over the P2W part of all games because that is where we are in gaming. Just get over yourselves and if you want to play the game for free just don't spend any money, simple. Lastly; they should add voices, I mean how hard would it be to get sound bites from the shows, and this game is fun, funny, and fantastic. Pick it up!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1495264961}
review:
[h1]I heard about "Childhood Ruined"...but "Adulthood R*ped"?!  Well, now I have...[/h1]

Well....that was something...

[i]Animation Throwdown: The Quest for Cards[/i] is an obvious mobile port of a card game involving quite a few animated series known in the history of FOX entertainment.  These include [i]King of the Hill[/i], [i]Family Guy[/i], [i]Bob's Burgers[/i], [i]American Dad[/i], and [i]Futurama[/i].  The gameplay mimics that of the cardgame in [i]Evoland 2[/i], but falls short of being dubbed "entertaining".  If you simply have more cards (or worse...STRONGER cards), then you win....that said, this IS P2W and you will learn that quickly.  Shortly after you get your first 5 achievements as a matter of fact.

I will say that I DID enjoy this game for the short while that it felt balanced and free...however, it's simply a tactic to lure in unsuspecting patrons who simply wanted a free game.  Played for free (until it turns P2W), this game is actually kinda' fun.  Throw cards on a field and have them destroy one another, though it could use refinement.  You cannot have a card attack in the same turn it's put down and to use your turn you MUST use a card.  A shuffle system could probably help if you have nothing but crap cards in your hand.

The difficulty spike appears in Chapter 3 of the main campaign and a few rounds into the Vs. Arena mode.  Good luck winning when people have already paid to win.  Progression practically demands that you pay to continue with the sudden difficulty change.  You'll often find the game trying to point you to the direction of the store and urge you to pay real money just to continue or to get stronger.

This game is littered with all your cheesy little catchphrases and watered down humor from the series you loved (or hated), so the comedy simply isn't present.  Overall, it's simply catering to the fans who loved the series but simply feel forced.  If you get a laugh out of something lame like Roger wanting Pecan Sandies, then you already get the vibe of what the comedy is like...Heck, voice-acted lines would make the text-only dialogue more entertaining.

If you want a few achievements, go ahead and try it out...but keep in mind that it may hurt your AGC%.  Personally, I'd say to avoid this title unless you've really run out of things to do... in which case, it's only good for about half an hour before you get sick of this game.

3/10  A cashgrab that will r*pe your nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011333720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1508269601}
review:
I've been playing this game for months on Kongregate and android and I still cannot reccommend it. It's fun if you aren't a competitive person that doesn't mind losing and you will lose, all of the time. If you are a competitive person be prepaired to spend thousands of dollars because that's what it'll take to compete at the top and get the best cards. Their updates are great in writing, but just come off as slaps in the face when implemented. Again, as long as you're a casual player and don't care about winning, it's an okay game. I saw people complaining about resolution, all you have to do is resize the window by moving the edges.

Pros
-Fun and addicting
-Cards reference memorable moments from the shows
-It's a card game with shows many people love; a reason I still play it and can't get into other card games

Cons
-Competing with top players costs thousands of dollars; Pay to win once you progress far enough
-Updates are good when they announce them, then they crap on you by giving you the least possible reward they can get away with ex. This recent update added a new pack, "Golden Turd Pack" and it costs 1000 golden turds. You can only get around 9 max from a battle and that's never guarranteed. You only get maybe 2-3 so that's almost 1000 battles minimum to get one pack.
-Lots of bugs
-Horrible RNG that causes losses before you can even play anything
-Pre-combos; The game is centered around researching and comboing your cards, but they keep adding overpowered cards that don't require you to combo
-Weeks-months of grinding to get cards people can just pay to get right away
-No more grinding battles to get upgraded cards called epics that would allow free players to almost compete with pay to win players. You now have to grind challenges that last 2-3 days or a week. New free players won't be able rank very high to be able to even get those upgraded cards for weeks or months while pay to win players rank high and continue to get free cards.

I come off as someone complaining about this game very harshly, but I do in fact still play this game everyday and participate in rumbles. I'm not trying to crap on the game, it's just that the good things are just barely there enough to notice them and the bad things jump out at you. Once and for all; if you are a casual card battle game player and you enjoy these toons as I do, you will enjoy this game, just be prepared to be frustrated every time you play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960393604', 'num_games_owned': 2763, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 1758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1645161307}
review:
I'd like to recommend this game, but there are problems with it.  The most notable is that the "Free to Play" aspect is severely limited on this particular release.  You see, this is a port of a mobile game, and it is available on a Kongregate (a Flash portal) as a free to play PC release.  The thing is, both the Mobile and the Kong versions use advertisements to give a benefit in game.  This includes increase drop rates, increased money, and the ability to open crates that give extra turns.

Steam does not allow for ads like that to be used in games on their platform (which is a policy I support).  To work around this, the game offers a subscription-like fee in "VIP Passes", which give you some premium currency every day, a higher energy cap (this is a game on a timer for plays, hence the 'extra turns' above), and thanks to the Steam release, the ability to get all the ad bonuses without watching ads.  Even if you link your accounts, and watch the ads on another format (Mobile or Kong), they do not impact the Steam version at all.  You simply don't even get the crates to drop without the VIP Pass, to open elsewhere.  You cannot get the added drop chances, and increased in-game gold.

Beyond that, if you want to utilize the game's chat, for talking with your clan and the like, the game just shoves you off to play the Kong version anyway!  It doesn't open it up in-game, like it does with Mobile.  No, it points you to a place where you can play a more complete version, and have chat open while you do so.

Animation Throwdown, on Steam, is not worth playing because of these issues.  If you want to play it for free, do so on Kong, where you can get the full benefit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011708011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1494713685}
review:
Review based on experience from playing for 4+ month on kong

---------------------------------------------------

Short and sweet DO NOT PLAY!

And now the reasons

do you have a lot of spare money?
do you like to pay to play a game?
do you like random luck detemining your prize after spending your money?
do you like waiting..a LOT of waiting?
do you like doing the same thing..over..and over..and over again?
do you like games with no "game" just a textbox and pictures?
do you like Unfair AI?

then play this game!!!

ok...why is this game bad?

lets start with..theres NO bonus for linking your kong account..no loyalty or thank you

then we have the currency (gems) they give you 100 to start..but you need 150-300 to actually spend them

NEXT we have the BIGGEST F-U...this game has the "watch ad gain bonus" removed..instead you will have to spend money to buy the bonus

next the cards and research..to play the "game" you need to make combo cards by researching recipes
common takes 1 hour to finish
rare (green) takes 8 hours
epic (blue) takes 24 hours
Legendary (purple) takes..48 HOURS!!

since you only have two research slots your gonna be waiting...oh and you don't know the result till its finished

next "adventure mode"....you click a picture...win/lose...click the next picture...move on...no script no plot no story at all

next the challenges..enjoy doing the same challenge over and and over ands they repeat and re-use them 

rumbles!..join a guild and watch as people who bought a load of gems crush you!

arena...battle the AI and slowly unlock heros..dont worry if you lose you keep your points!..till level 10 then if you lose..you lose points

buying boxes/cards 10 cards epic and legendary....random chance what you get!

if you want a click/idle game that BETTER..MUCH BETTER than this cash grab and is fun to play..try Crush Crush...STAY AWAY from this cash grab lazy uncreative sack of rubbish!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041967011', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 536, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1494095023}
review:
На дух не переношу эту скверную систему ограниченной энергии, время которой прошло ещё лет 5 тому назад. На 5 минут игры приходится 2 часа ожидания перезарядки. Донат просто зверский, похлеще топовых ААА игрушек с их скинами и DLC. Сразу при входе предложили вложить около $150, типа я миллионер, а в бесплатную игру зашел чисто случайно, ага.

Если вас интересует стандартный объективный обзор, идите читать сюда: http://igrotop.com/posts/5119

Ещё о местном донате. Все покупки временные, то есть, перманентно не купишь ничего. Есть куча всяких расходников, развитие пределов колоды, ивенты, но всё это продвигается сугубо за баблинское. А ещё в Steam-версии присутствует странная задержка показа карты аж в 3 секунды, что просто вымораживает. Рекомендовать не могу, так как местные цены совершенно не заслуженны. Лучше купить тогда уже Yu-Gi-Oh, Magic The Gathering, Демиурги 2, King's Bounty и ещё останется, а в Animation Throwdown всего этого хватит дней на 5 комфорта.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974772687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1494035876}
review:
I think it is important to have a good review for the launch of a game so here is a good honest review from what I have played so far.  I think the other reviews are not adequate.

First of all-- the game is really awesome for being free.  Many complain because they don't have the patience to invest their time into a game that is pretty cool and want all the goodies immediately.  They complain that the game is a "cash grab" while convienently forgetting that the game comes free and everything can be gotten freely.

These are the types who used "Game Genie" and "Gameshark".  Now let's be honest.  The game is fleshed out pretty nicely with many game modes.  I DONT get the hate.  I want to be honest, this is a cool game.

The biggest draw for me so far though is the combos which remind us of our favorite shows and have already had me laughing a few times.  It's like you can research these combinations of the cards that give you moments from certain episodes of the shows.  Like if you combine Gene with a Restaurant card you get:  Beefsquatch.  He gains power every turn he does damage.  Or if you combine Alcohol with Mort you get "Samantha".  There are also cards for "drugs" "crack" "weapon" "art"  These are combined with the character cards to bring back moments from the shows!

Most of the cards have over 25 combinations, some over 70!  So its exploring the shows we like all over again and reliving our favorite moments!  Another cool one is combining alcohol with Linda makes a combo card called "The Tatas"  ^_^  Obviously there are going to be very rare combos which will be awesome to find and collect.  

All the cards have cool special abilities and every special ability has a very likable animation in the game.!
The battles can be sped up for grinding.  It's very streamlined.  When you have a bunch of cards down, there is definitely an effect of a battle with shaking and slamming and all kinds of effects going off.

There is no reason for you not to play this game if you like collectible card games and any of these 4 tv shows.!  Also, Everyone watches these shows so playing with friends or showing off the game is a no brainer.!

Closing thoughts, its slightly simple and shallow in its gameplay.?  Obviously it has waiting times to progress through the game but who really exhausts these energy timers anyway?  Go play another game for an hour or go stretch.  It's a game you load up everyday, do the grind, level shit up, and log out.  Eventually you will have an awesome deck to brag about.  It isn't going to test your wits very much, so if your looking for something with the depth of MTG or Hearthstone you MAY want to pass.  I strongly urge you to try it for at least an hour, I highly recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093681659', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 70698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1618321063}
review:
Пишу сразу, что эта мобильная игра является типичной выкачивалкой денег (pay to win). Хотите вступить в топовую гильдию и получать призы на рамблах, побеждать на арене, занимать лучшие места в челленджах, то вам придётся вливать каждый месяц по сотне баксов, ибо в игре решает только донат. Кстати, призы не стоят потраченных для их получения сил и времени. И если вы всё же решитесь донатить и покупать карты, то как вы поняли, выигранные карты не принесут вам особой пользы. А без доната достигнуть высоких результатов у вас не получится. Ставлю 3/10.


Играю с сентября 2016 года и уже давно бы стоило забросить её, но что-то меня в ней держит...

Link Your Account SAVE YOUR SELF FROM THE TUTORIAL

- http://www.kongregate.com/steam
- log into your kong account that use on your phone

author: {'steamid': '76561198037960181', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1559676492}
review:
Here's the short version:
I played a lot of this on my phone before,
and never actually had to spend anything on it,
yet here I am, rather powerful.
Well - the way farming works changed since then.
You can't just get the Epics you want by farming,
you have to master levels on Onyx difficulty to get them as 100% guaranteed rewards.
But if you have the patience (I had the patience.) it's definitely worth it. 
Feels very satisfying to obliterate high level pay-to-win players, really. ~

review:
I may not have played alot of this game (on steam) but I have played alot on IOS.

The game is exactly the same as it is on IOS, I also get the same amount of enjoyment.

It's a fun game, like how often do you get to see Roger kick Megs butt in a fight, not very.

Good game, 7/10 would play again.
